unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Unseen Sunscreen Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text:
Long story short; Pairs well with my skin routine and works well under my foundation as a primer. No irritation and is an awesome primer. Makes skin feel nice. No smell, feels nice on the skin. Does its job. Nice matte finish and very easy on the skin :) Cons; cannot re-apply over makeup, makes my face cakey. I want to try the other products like the mist or brush to re-apply.


Detailed review; I have combo skin and I am avid make-up user in Miami. I use a drunk elephant skin routine (Protini Polypeptide Cream, C-Firma Fresh Day Serum, B-Hydra Intensive Hydration Serum, Marula Oil) under this sunscreen primer and it works sooo well with the Lanc√¥me Teint Idole Long Wear Foundation and Tarte Shape Tape concealer. I've also paired it with the Maybelline Fit Me foundation and works well, too! 

It goes on LOVELY on the skin and is a great primer. It feels like a matte film that dissolves into the skin after a minute. My foundation also has sunscreen, it pairs well. Its been nice to wear with my make-up routine. The only con is, I cannot re-apply it over my make-up because it gives it a cakey texture. The cost is very high for me but after using it daily (pea size goes a long way!) it has been a great bang for my buck. I purchased it in March of 2022 and still have some in my bottle in October of 2022! I don't have to buy more for another month or so. No skin reaction at all! Nice matte finish. Buy it! :)

review_title: My tried and true ride or die!
review_text: I have extremely sensitive skin that does not react well to sunscreens. I have tried many, many sunscreens (Josie Maran, Beauty of Joseon, Dr. Jart, Fenty Skin, even other Supergoop sunscreens), and they have all left my skin red, irritated, and itchy. This is the only sunscreen I've ever used that hasn't irritated my skin. It has a very unique texture (similar to the Benefit Porefessional) that is very blurring and smoothing, while still being soft and hydrating. It has great packaging and little to no scent (at least that I can smell). Supergoop knocked it out of the park for the sensitive skin folks on this one, and I hope they never reformulate.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: Miraclescreen for acne-prone babe in Caribbean
review_text:
About me: I am a very fair-skinned 31 year old who has the joy of sensitive, acne-prone skin and nasolabial folds/forehead wrinkles from laughing all the time. I live between the Pacific Northwest in the US and the tropics of Latin America. So not only am I traveling a lot, but I'm also contending with mega UV exposure, full sun, humidity, year-round, during sweaty activities like hiking, running, and surfing. Sunscreen tends to clog my pores and build up, cause rashes, give me deep underground zits that sit in my skin for 1-2 months (which are not common for me), build up in my wrinkles and cause zits there, make my hair horribly greasy, not actually protect me in wind/water, or not playing nicely under/over makeup during casual wear. For a while I just gave up trying to look attractive while also wearing sunscreen which kinda sucks cause it's a daily necessity. That was until Matte Screen.

About why I love this sunscreen: Because I have so many skin concerns that are aggravated by chemical sunscreens, the mineral formula of this is necessary. I even find that my skin is clearer after using it. It's not a wet-greasy formula as much as it's a whipped smooth texture (kind of like silicon primer). The coverage mattifies and smoothes the skin while not looking like you're wearing foundation and caking up with sweat/water. I find that if I apply it every 2 hours when I'm just out and about and every hour if I'm in the sun doing activities (surfing/hiking/swimming) I don't get burnt, or even get color (which is ideal for me). It lasts for 1-2 months w/ regular use

Other sunscreens I have tried and rejected:
‚ÄîNeutrogena Clear Face Liquid Lotion Sunscreen for Acne-Prone Skin, Broad Spectrum SPF 55
‚ÄîShiseido Urban Environment Oil-Free Sunscreen Spf 42
‚ÄîMurad Acne Control Oil and Pore Control Mattifier Broad Spectrum SPF 45 PA++++
‚ÄîCoola Classic Face Sunscreen SPF 50 White Tea
‚ÄîAlba Botanica Facial Sunscreen Lotion, SPF 45
‚ÄîSupergoop Unseen Sunscreen SPF 40 PA+++

My skin doesn‚Äôt feel irritated or dry whatsoever and it feels like barely anything is there. Absolutely no white cast on my skin (though I have fair skin, so I am not sure how it is for people of different skin tones). This is a dreamy facial sunscreen from a brand I‚Äôve long been a fan of. My one and only gripe, and the reason it‚Äôs not a five star product is that you pay quite a hefty price for this product. Considering how much sunscreen is needed to protect the face and neck area, I feel like it‚Äôs a luxury to use this product, when it is something I use everyday. I would hope they could increase the size of this product because I‚Äôd love to see a larger size available, but the price point feels prohibitive.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: Have been using for 3 years now and it‚Äôs the only thing I will use.  As a minimal makeup person, it has a great natural look that blurs the skin really well and blends into so many complexions nicely.  The mineral formula doesn‚Äôt feel greasy and controls shine throughout the day.  Holy grail for me.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I'm combo skin (oily in my t-zone) and this gives me a great matte finish all day. It's an immediate blur that is great under foundation or with concealer. A little goes a long way and make sure you take the time to rub it in completely and set for a few seconds. Highly recommend.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I use this everyday as a smoothing and oil controlling base. Works well under foundation or on its own. I find it‚Äôs evening enough to put blush and bronzer on over it

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: take time to rub and blend into skin!
review_text: I really love this sunscreen! It‚Äôs matte but not drying and feels great on the skin and I love the texture it leaves‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs very silk like BUT YOU HAVE TO KEEP RUBBING IT IN. This isn‚Äôt something that you rub on your face for 5 seconds and it‚Äôs fine‚Ä¶ no. You have to rub it in for about 30- 45 seconds and after you will see how it blends and sinks so well on your skin otherwise it will just sit in your skin and it seems like it‚Äôs pilling when it‚Äôs not. Yes it may take longer than you‚Äôre probably used to but it‚Äôs the only sunscreen that doesn‚Äôt make me oily, greasy, or smelling like sunscreen. Also this doesn‚Äôt irritate my skin either because it‚Äôs a mineral sunscreen and It sits so well under makeup. I have medium/tan skin and it looks great on my skin tone.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: It does not pill! Initially when it goes on the skin it looks like it‚Äôs pilling, but it‚Äôs not. You just have to continue rubbing it in. I tested this on freshly washed skin with no other skincare products then put my Kosas foundation and concealer on and it was perfect. I have very oily, acne prone skin and this kept my makeup on all day, through a workout and nap. Give it a go and if you hate it, return it- But great for oily skin!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: This is my all time favourite sunscreen and I have tried dozens from different brands. It has a slight tint that helps to prevent a white cast and it does not sting your eyes. Also, it doesn't leave your skin greasy like many sunscreens do.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: One of the best products ever made! I have been using this for about two years now and I use EVERYDAY! I also have dry skin and sensitive skin and have no issues with it affecting my texture or pores.

review_text:
I have been using this sunscreen for 2 years now, great for oily skin. Keeps my face matte throughout the day only need a couple of tissue to keep my face oil free throughout the day. Even with oil i do not get any shine. However when i paired it with some of my moisturizers it can peel/ clump up during application. If you use a moisturize that does not contain silicon this sunscreen will work wonders! 

I have gone through so many brands of sunscreen and i always go back to this! IT has a mattifying effect and slight tint that goes well for my medium skin tone!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I love this product.  I use this on those days where I'm not putting on foundation but I want a little bit of coverage and definitely sun protection.  It starts out looking a little orange, but I'm about as pale as you can get, and surprisingly it blends in and looks pretty natural, even on my ghostly pale skin.  It keeps my skin matte and I feel it looks really great for a minimal makeup look.  I don't think I'd ever wear this as a primer under makeup, but I also don't feel like I need to wear makeup over it as it blurs well.  This is pretty much the only thing I wear for vacations now and I love that this is all I have to take for complexion products!  Definitely a fav I'll continue to buy.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: Really wanted to love this. I DO think it‚Äôs a great, incredibly smooth sunscreen with a bit of tint. But under makeup? Just don‚Äôt. This was literally the only thing I did differently in my normal makeup routine, and it made my completely separate and cake in my T-zone. Would probably be fine for someone that doesn‚Äôt become oily with makeup on throughout the day. Normally I use Lanc√¥me foundation, Dermablend translucent setting powder and Mac Prep + Fix spray and I get a bit shiny lateen on but it stays smooth looking. I‚Äôll still probably keep this just for the sunscreen, but I‚Äôm sad I won‚Äôt be able to use this as a primer as it claims it is.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Mattescreen SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I have acne-prone skin and this product did not break me out at all! My first purchase I was a complete fan and I loved how smooth it went on to my skin and it lasted me a good while! My second purchase didn‚Äôt go as well, I felt like it was harder to apply evenly (even when I shook the tube before applying) and it also got this really weird smell that wasn‚Äôt there the first time. I also went through the tube a lot faster as getting a good amount of product was difficult. Not sure if it was the batch or there was a slight formula change. But I ended up not enjoying it enough for the price, so I am no longer purchasing. I do recommend though, good for acne-prone/sensitive skin and a great starter for those getting into sunscreen. Could be better on redness coverage but the tint is still there.

It also has a cooling sensation from the eucalyptus. But while it may lack the cosmetic elegance of their other spfs, this is still a great offering. As a body spf, this feels moisturizing, rubs in quickly, and offers solid protection. Since it's offered through FSA/HSA, we've already repurchased a larger size.

review_text:
At first it was great, then a month or so after opened, I noticed the formula of the product became wayyy too oily. 

But worry not, I figured out the correct way and to keep the product not oily. Simply just shake your bottle/tube each time before usage. And always warm up the product on your palm rather than straight away apply it on the face or body.

It gives glowy & dewy look. Great for base too.

Best value for money product and definitely will repeat! 

Thanks me later ;)

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting 100% Mineral Powder Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 35 PA+++
review_text: I used to work in skincare development and we always absconded with these plastic 2-in-1 dispenser bottle brushes because they never work properly - 10 years on and nothing has changed. I could not get sufficient product to dispense into the brush; no matter how much I shook or tapped the container, all I would get is a thin streak that would blow off before I could even get it to my face. At one point I emptied as much powder from the bottle brush as I could into the cap of another jar and applied THAT powder (similar to how you apply Laura Mercier translucent powder), and this was about 4 hours after I had already applied sunscreen lotion and makeup, but the powder is so awfully chalky, even on my fair skin it separated after about 20 minutes in the sun and did nothing to prevent sunburn on my nose where I had applied it liberally. Trash product, will return.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting 100% Mineral Powder Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 35 PA+++
review_title: Perfect‚Ä¶ if you aren‚Äôt piling on product.
review_text: I didn‚Äôt like this at first but then I realized I was layering too many products in the summer for my super oily skin. I was applying toner, moisturizer, the Unseen Sunscreen, and primer. This works perfect for cooler months. When I was still getting oily shine this summer my first instinct was to add this powder to further mattify and touch up during the day. That was a bad call because it didn‚Äôt wear well during the summer day, but neither did my other products. I took a step back and tried my routine with just toner and the Unseen Sunscreen for a week and loved the results but still wanted a little but more shine reduction. I recently added the powder and am loving the combo. Bottom line, by the time I was adding the powder my face was overloaded. It looked great at first but product would break down midday and retouching only made it worse because then it looked cakey. Now, I finally figured out the best summer skincare for my skin type. Toner, Unseen Sunscreen, and this powder are perfect. This product is great as long as you don‚Äôt pile too many products on your skin.

The formula is very soft and it easily eliminates any shininess left behind by my cream sunscreen. It makes my face look great and I don‚Äôt find myself having sensory issues with my sunscreen anymore. I pair this with the hero brand sunscreen if anyone was wondering. Definitely try this out I totally recommend it

review_title: easy to apply, tough to gauge coverage
review_text:
I tried this and the resetting spray and found this was very easy to apply during the day and over makeup. However I am not entirely sure how much product you would need to use to actually get the SPF 35. For this reason I plan to still use this but as a ¬´¬†refresh¬†¬ª throughout the day, rather than as my main form of daily spf. Pros if this product as compared to other ¬´¬†brush on¬†¬ª spfs: this one has much better packaging. Clear on/off for powder disbursement and there is an interior ¬´¬†tube¬†¬ª that protects the brush bristles from being fan√¢tes when taking the outer tube (lid) on and off. 

As compared with the spray, his was easier to apply. I think I need to try the full-size spray before making a definitive rec btwn the two, as the spray nozzle on the travel size I got was faulty. (I think the package was a dud as opposed to the product not being good!)

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting 100% Mineral Powder Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 35 PA+++
review_text:
This is my new holy grail loose powder!!! I can‚Äôt review it as a sunscreen because I always use it over a liquid sunscreen or SPF foundation, but I am in love with this powder. It‚Äôs so light and so fine - doesn‚Äôt look cakey at all and sets my whole face of makeup without sinking into my fine lines or sitting on top of my foundation/concealer. I‚Äôve tried SO many powders - Laura Mercier, Wander, every Bare Minerals, Charlotte Tilbury, Cover FX - vainly searching for something that would set under my eyes without enhancing the texture of my skin, and this is finally it. It also doesn‚Äôt get oily after multiple hours of wear like the Bare Minerals original does. I have combination skin and this truly gives my skin a natural airbrushed look in the best way. I also love that it‚Äôs self contained so I can throw it in my bag and reapply if/when needed. 

I have combination skin and wear this over liquid foundation (It CC+), cream blush and bronzer (Milk), and concealer (Fenty Pro Filt‚Äôr for highlight and Lancome Teint Idole for coverage).

So, can‚Äôt use it on the go which is why I bought it.  I can open up powder container and put it in tray but I can‚Äôt use brush.  The center powder dispenser (that doesn‚Äôt work) is the same length as bristles, so it scratches my face when I use the brush.  Such a poorly designed item.

review_text: I bought this to have a sunscreen touch-up option that i can easily carry around in my purse and apply without getting greasy hands. This powder option fit the bill. The packaging is compact and the product applies easily. It is translucent and doesn't cover up whatever makeup i already have on. I like that I can click the container open and closed so product doesn't leak into the lid when not in use. i don't like that you have to sort f mush the bristles together to get them back in the lid so as not to crush them (which is why I removed a star).

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting 100% Mineral Powder Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 35 PA+++
review_text:
This obviously works great for some people, but it didn't work for me: I love the idea and had no problems with the dispenser, but the powder just sat on top of my makeup. I wouldn't say it was cakey, exactly, but visible. I've worked hard, with different moisturizers and primers, to keep my foundation at a natural-looking matte finish, and this looked powdery and unnatural up close (it looked okay from maybe four feet away, which is why I gave it two stars). 

Supergoop clearly needs to keep working on their resetting/reapplication SPF products. The resetting spray works better for me than the powder (at least half the time, it works perfectly; the rest of the time, it has an equivalent problem, causing my makeup to shift a little and settle weirdly into my pores), but neither is what I want it to be.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting 100% Mineral Powder Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 35 PA+++
review_text: I have super oily skin and I don't wear makeup. I usually use an SPF moisturizer but I wanted this to be able to reapply SPF later in the day and not make my skin more oily. Getting the powder to come out wasn't a problem. The problem was that the first time I used it, I tried to use the brush to blend it in and smooth it out like you would with a translucent setting powder. All that did was pill like crazy. Not my favorite. So the next time I tried just dabbing the powder all over my face and waited for it to naturally absorb and mix in with my already oily skin. That seemed to work fine. It created a matte layer that looked smooth and I went about my day. However, a few hours later when I tried to apply the powder again (I'd like to at least try to get in the habit of re-applying every two hours if I can) it just broke up the first layer of powder and created a patchy, pilling mess.  So truly I can only get one good SPF reapplication out of this product. Which is better than nothing, that's why the 3 stars but ultimately I wanted something that I could use throughout the day and this just isn't it. I don't think I will end up repurchasing as a result.

review_text: Its actually not bad. I like it, it gives a nice matte finish, as well as spf coverage. Only complaints is the terrible application process and the container. Its not that easy to get the product out onto the bristles and on your face. Sometimes I‚Äôm not even sure if its working. And other times i just see dust in the air. But once on your face, it just blends in without altering the color of your makeup. Takes down the shine if that is what youre looking for. Its also really easy to carry around for reapplication out and about. Ive suffed it inside cute 3D purses and its been ok. Its a good product that needs more improved packaging (but at the same time the concept OF the packaging is perfect). Hope that makes sense and helps!

unique_id: FENTY SKIN-Hydra Vizor Invisible Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Sunscreen Moisturizer
review_text: I was very excited for this product when I first bought it! I said, this will be my new staple moisturizer. It has SPF and all that jazz so yeah, it serves its purpose. But now that I've been using it, I dunno. It's not that bad but it's not that great either, at least for me. I have oily-to-combination skin. unique_id: FENTY SKIN-Hydra Vizor Invisible Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Sunscreen Moisturizer
review_title: The only sunscreen that's suitable for my sensitive skin
review_text: The first time I wore sunscreen was when I was 15 (2014), and it was a horrible experience. It irritated my skin so badly, and it made my skin burn (my skin became darker). Then I stopped using sunscreen for a while, until my friends suggested some. I gave them a try but they weren't any better than the previous one. I stopped using sunscreen since then. But when Fenty came out with a skincare line, I was wondering if my skin was not as sensitive as before or not. But I waited almost a year since their first launch for other people's feedbacks and specialists' reviews. While I was 'waiting' to try it out, I bought this one sunscreen from a dermatologist-recommended skin care brand (it only has SPF 15 - from my readings, higher amount of SPF tends to irritate sensitive skin more). But it was just the same as the other sunscreens I've tried. So I gave up in finding the right one for me, including Fenty's. But reading the comments on their instagram changed my mind, I wanted to give it a try. If it's good, I'd continue to use it.. else, I'd stop and just give up and won't be using any sunscreens for the rest of my life. And I'm so glad I gave it a chance ‚ù§Ô∏è It's not only a good sunscreen for me, but it also plays well under makeup. I can apply Fenty Beauty Pro Filt'r Soft Matte foundation (which dries down fast) easier and better ‚ù§Ô∏è

unique_id: FENTY SKIN-Hydra Vizor Invisible Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Sunscreen Moisturizer
review_title: Feels luxurious - probably a better moisturiser than sunscreen?
review_text:
It really does what it says - it's lightweight and glides on and absorbs seamlessly into the skin, and it smells great (almost like passionfruit?). I feel like it even helps to even out my uneven skin texture with a blurring effect - just a little bit. All in all I feel good wearing this.  

I like that niacinamide (vitamin B3 which has many health benefits) is one of the top few ingredients. It also has hyaluronic acid (sodium hyaluronate). 

I can't confirm or deny the sunscreen function of it as I naturally don't burn easily. I assume it works. 

However, if you have very sensitive skin, you may want to stay away from this moisturiser  as it does have fragrance. However, it's one of the last few ingredients, so the concentration of it is probably quite low. 

I love that it's refillable, making this overall an economical option as it's both moisturiser and sunscreen, and many good 50ml sunscreens/moisturisers are already around 40 SGD each or more. However, I may not be reordering as I would like to find a dedicated mineral sunscreen with zinc oxide instead of non-FDA approved chemicals like AVOBENZONE, HOMOSALATE, OCTISALATE.

unique_id: FENTY SKIN-Hydra Vizor Invisible Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Sunscreen Moisturizer
review_text: Apart from the pretty packaging, I‚Äôm a fan of this sunscreen‚Äôs fruity scent. This product feels hydrating on the skin and has a dewy finish. It‚Äôs quite pricey to repurchase but good thing Fenty Skin promotes sustainability. I just need to buy a refill once I run out of this spf.

unique_id: FENTY SKIN-Hydra Vizor Invisible Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Sunscreen Moisturizer
review_text:
What I love
‚Ä¢ 2-in-1 moisturizer and SPF (good for the lazy days)
‚Ä¢ no white cast
‚Ä¢ nice sensorial experience, lightweight texture, nice scent, easy to apply
What I don‚Äôt love

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Glow Stick Sunscreen SPF 50 PA++++
review_text: I have really been enjoying this product for the past month. I appreciate the fact that I can‚Äôt detect any discernible scent from it. I like wearing it by itself and with my primer and makeup. My skin is very dry, and I enjoy how smooth and glowy it makes my face feel. You may find that your makeup doesn‚Äôt stay on as perfectly as it would without it, but I don‚Äôt mind how my makeup wears throughout the day, and I would rather have the SPF protection than not. I also keep a travel size bottle of the SPF setting spray at my desk at work so I can add more sun protection throughout the day while wearing makeup. If it‚Äôs a no-makeup day, I will apply throughout the day, sometimes blotting my face with a tissue to remove older product before applying a new layer. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend putting this product on your eyelids if you sweat a lot‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt feel great when it runs into your eyes. As someone who is trying to incorporate SPF into their everyday skincare routine, I think these are very useful products that streamline the process.

review_text:

I wear light make up and I let the sunscreen absorb first before putting in my foundation - as per instructions at the packaging. It also gives my skin the dewy glow which I like very much because I prefer oily looking skin than dry flaky skin any day! this is the best sunscreen I have ever tried because it doesn't feels like I'm wearing sunscreen, it hydrates my skin and doesn't smell weird at all. unique_id: GLOW RECIPE-Watermelon Glow Niacinamide Sunscreen SPF 50
review_text: Honestly it‚Äôs not as bad as everyone makes it seem to be. Personally, I like this product Bc of the high SPF. I don‚Äôt think the Niacinamide in it has done much for me. This will pill if you put it on immediately after your moisturizer. As long as you leave a gap between the application of the two you should be fine. Also, this does leave a white cast for a bit after the initial application but it does end up going away. I also enjoy the glow it gives me. I would say the big downside to this is if you rub your eyes hours after application and you somehow get some sunscreen in your eyes while doing so, it will burn. I‚Äôm in between a 3 and a 4 but Bc of the burn and not seeing a difference in skin unevenness with the niacinamide, it‚Äôs a 3. However, I will most likely repurchase again purely Bc it‚Äôs an SPF 50 and you don‚Äôt see that often.

unique_id: GLOW RECIPE-Watermelon Glow Niacinamide Sunscreen SPF 50
review_title: There are better options out there
review_text: I was so excited for this! I recently got into sunscreen at 33yrs old and have been on the hunt for something glowy and moisturizing for the upcoming Winter season. It was a blind buy, meaning I didn't bother reading reviews or do any sort of research, which was my first mistake. I had slight irritation throughout the day, it most definitely has white cast and from my experience, you CAN NOT use it over other skincare. The first day I used it, I applied a Hyaluronic Acid Serum first like I always do every morning. I let that dry down and then I applied the Glow Recipe. It looked fine to me, but then i had gone to do my brows with my magnifying mirror, and that‚Äôs when I saw all the small piles of pilling scattered on my face. I thought maybe I did something wrong so I looked up reviews and sure enough, it was a common issue. Another review stated to use it on a clean face without anything underneath so that‚Äôs what I did the next day and I had no pilling whatsoever BUT I still had slight irritation throughout the day. Giving it two stars because the glow it gave me was *chef's kiss* but not worth it to me to keep.

experienced pilling. Gave it 2 stars because it feels nice on the rest of my body.

unique_id: GLOW RECIPE-Watermelon Glow Niacinamide Sunscreen SPF 50
review_text:
I could not figure out how to apply this product and have it not pill/ball up for most of the summer.  I read the reviews warning of this problem but thought maybe it was exaggerated because there were so many other good reviews I thought I would give it a try.  After trying it over and over again I think I figured out how to apply but there are too many caveats for me to buy again.

Pros-
-Great for my dry and sensitive skin. 
-White cast does go away after rubbing (but I do have pale skin)
-Skin looks dewy and pearlescent, no tint but to me gives a great "no makeup" makeup look.
-No scent.
-Didn't burn my eyes.



Cons-
- I can ONLY WEAR IT BY ITSELF.  No essence; no serum; no toner; no makeup (I tried under eye concealer and blush) under or on top of; no water on my face, hands, or hair line, OR IT WILL PILL UP/FLAKE OFF IMMEDIATELY.
-When applying I can only apply about a finger tip dab amount at a time to one area of my face, rub it until the white cast is gone (maybe two or three seconds) and then stop rubbing and apply in next area of face.  If I apply about a quarter/ generous dollop amount and massage into face or, God forbid,  keep massaging after white cast has gone it will PILL UP AND FLAKE OFF IMMEDIATELY.
-And when I say flake off I mean it looks like the whole product crumbles like parmesan cheese all over the place and you have to keep brushing it off your neck, lip gloss, eye lashes and clothes for the rest of the day. 
- Am not great at reapplying sun screen like you should but imagine that would be impossible for me and have it not flake off.

unique_id: GLOW RECIPE-Watermelon Glow Niacinamide Sunscreen SPF 50
review_text: It does some pilling even with all Glow Recipe products underneath. So I use it on my arms and legs and it is better there. I use it on my face when I barely have anything on and don't use a lot. Won't be buying it again but glad I tried it.

unique_id: GLOW RECIPE-Watermelon Glow Niacinamide Sunscreen SPF 50
review_text: No. Just no. If you put anything on your skin before this, it will pill. And I like to use at least a vitamin C serum before sunscreen. The way to avoid pilling is to apply in very small little sections slowly and rub lightly and pat in, and ain't nobody got time for that. I can't decide if I will donate this or keep as an early AM gym sunscreen when I have nothing else on my face.

The only time I‚Äôve tried putting this on my face full-strength is when I am going indoor tanning, which is why I bought it.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-CC Screen 100% Mineral CC Cream Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 50 PA+++
review_text: I have melasma (dark brown-grey patches all over my face), and this product provides top-notch protection against all the UV factors that can exacerbate my condition!  For me, mineral, zinc oxide based sunscreens provide superior protection against UVA rays, and they don't absorb the rays and heat (which can trigger melasma) like chemical suncreens.  This particular sunscreen also is PA++++ (the best you can get with 4 + signs) for UV protection.  In addition, tinted physical sunblocks that use iron oxides for the tint provide protection against visible light (which is almost half of the light that we experience) and even blue light from computer devices.  This last part we all should be concerned with, but if you have melasma, it's critical to get a sunscreen that has iron oxides in it!  This CC Screen provides all the protection I need AND 90% coverage for my melasma patches.  I imagine that finding a good color match is key (since this is full coverage and like a foundation), and I really lucked out here -- I'm half Caucasian / half Asian, and 226W is perfect on me -- and it's not even orange!  It's a lovely light golden yellow base, and it's a better color match for me than any expensive foundation I've tried.  You just have to work in the product well, since it is a sunscreen first and foremost.  But once you do, the coverage looks so natural -- not greasy at all.  I wear this in the daytime, and I wear the Supergoop Tinted Mattescreen at night.  If you don't want foundation like coverage, get the tinted Mattescreen (it's a light neutral-beige, mousse-like texture).

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-CC Screen 100% Mineral CC Cream Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 50 PA+++

The shade 215N is a tad light for me (usually I‚Äôm light medium neutral) but that‚Äôs OK because I love the brightening.

review_text:
I was shocked at how lovely this was on my skin after trying a couple others (tried the IT cosmetics one and it was basically like theatre makeup... just awful & I couldn't wait to wash it off). This goes on thick in terms of knowing you're getting the SPF coverage, but blends well and the whiteness goes away after a minute. It looks radiant & glowy and has great coverage without being heavy or pancakey. I thought the color would be too light until it settled. If I add a little quick contour with some bronzer (i'd recommend since the coverage is medium+), it looks like my normal light liquid makeup face. It's really beautiful on the skin and doesn't feel uncomfortable (I don't like the feeling of Ilia spf serum for instance, it feels heavy and icky). So this is my fave by FAR and I hope they DO NOT CHANGE IT! 

FYI I'm 45, very pale & have some hyperpigmentation marks from months/years past of acne (late in life). Pic is of a quick application today with only blush and a tiny bit of bronzer added.

I have super sensitive rosacea skin and this has never broken me out or irritated my skin! Please don‚Äôt ever discontinue this I don‚Äôt know what I would do if it was discontinued because literally nothing works for my skin! review_text: I was hesitant to try this product again after so many years of not using it and personally not really loving the old formula. But I‚Äôm pleasantly surprised with it. It does dry as you apply so that maybe some of the ‚Äúdryness‚Äù that people feel but if you need to blend an area a little better and it‚Äôs dried I just take water or a water based moisturizer on my finger and work that area. The water rehydrates the formula really well. You could prob even use a serum. I didn‚Äôt apply moisturizer before using this once and it was for sure harder to apply to bare skin. But overall I like the new formula. For having normal to dry skin.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-CC Screen 100% Mineral CC Cream Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 50 PA+++
review_text: This has definitely grown on me. On the days I spend more time outside and still want some coverage, I like to wear this over another sunscreen layer to minimize the risk of taking away protection. I trust Supergoop products and love how they post their SPF efficacy reports for full disclosure. Also, so many other mineral-based tinted sunscreen products have red undertones or that sickly zinc-based bluish purple cast, so I was very pleased to see options for golden undertones that actually work for my skin. For reference, I wear 346W and my other shade matches are MAC NC42, NARS Syracuse, Fenty 310, and Estee Lauder Double Wear 4N2. Texture-wise, it's a thicker, almost mousse-like consistency that's similar to the PUR Bare It All foundation, if you've ever used that, so I find this applies best with fingers or a brush. I get medium buildable coverage with a natural matte finish, which I prefer. I only wish this was also water/sweat-resistant, but otherwise, this personally ticks every box for me. All in all, very pleasantly surprised by this product.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-CC Screen 100% Mineral CC Cream Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 50 PA+++
review_text: First of all, I absolutely love the finish this gives. Idk why a lot of people don‚Äôt. I just if you‚Äôre looking for a matte finish then this wouldn‚Äôt suck to you. It is a bit weird to blend but that‚Äôs because it dries as it blends, kind of like the Fenty foundation. I appreciate this feature bc the finish not only is the finish dewy, it‚Äôs also not tacky and it creates a smooth film over the face, unlike the Ilia super serum tint (too oily). That aside, I have seen reviews about the colors being way off and at first I thought so too, but you have to remember this is a mineral sunscreen first and foremost. It takes time to blend in and oxidize to the correct shade so I really think everyone may be a shade lighter than they think. Because of this I don‚Äôt think the names are correct for this selection of shades. I am not fair, usually. This is the first time my correct shade is considered fair. I‚Äôm usually light skinned with yellow/warm undertones. So of course I didn‚Äôt go for the shade that actually matched me first, I went darker and it was a big mistake bc this oxidizes. The fair neutral turned out to be right for me because as it oxidizes it turns more warm. Frankly, this matches me more than any foundation ever has! So glad I didn‚Äôt listen to the reps at Sephora and just got sample of the shade I thought I‚Äôd be and one lighter. Try this out before you give up on this amazing cc cream.

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Lean Screen Mineral Mattifying SPF 50+
review_text: I was looking for a good SPF 50+ sunscreen that wouldn‚Äôt dry out my skin. The Ultra Violette checks all the boxes: gives a nice light overall tint, non-tacky feel, overall comfortable sit on the face. No breakouts so far.

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Lean Screen Mineral Mattifying SPF 50+
review_title: Want to love it but can't. It's everything it's not supposed to be.
review_text: The consistency and texture is thick like toothpaste. It never seems to "dry" and form that even protective layer. I can put it on at 7am and wait till 9am and my face will still be moist and sticky. It never becomes or looks matt. It oxidises, makes me look like a oily wok and gets on everything. From my long shirt sleeve when I shield my face to all my make up pencils, brushes, sponges, it stains everything and it never stops coming off! My make up powder (which I dont even apply a lot of) cakes on it. I really want to love it - it probably is one of the safest and high zinc content sunblocks that is cruelty free.. but I can't. I heard that Ultra Violette was created by people who knew that their products needed to work with make up but this is the total opposite of that goal. I'm really disappointed. I'm now rethinking if I want to try their other sunscreen or leave this expensive, ill-promised brand altogether :( It didnt work well for me, I unfortunately, dont recommend it. The formula definitely needs re-working.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_title: Spray nozzle could use some improvement
review_text: I like this product overall!  Used it on a trip to Mexico - beaches, sightseeing, etc - as a quick and easy way to re-apply some face SPF on the go.  I feel like it sufficiently helped to protect my skin in this environment!  It's a little too glowy for my oily skin, but powdering after helps, and since it's summer I'm just resigned to looking more dewy than preferred anyway :D  My two problems with this are 1) the spray nozzle wasn't great after the first few uses - it started spraying in large drops instead of a fine mist.  Wiping the nozzle before using helps a little, but not enough.  2) The price point.  This stuff is just too pricey for me.  I picked this up since I could throw it in my carry-on, but I just can't stomach paying so much for so little again.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: Love the SuperGoop product and delivery. No white caste, leaves makeup un-disturbed. Leaves a radiant finish that borders on greasy, so easy does it!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_title: Sprays out tiny globs of hardened product :(
review_text: I bought this to help refresh my spf as I'm trying to correct a dark spot problem and still be able to wear my make up. The pump on this product stopped working literally after one pump! My biggest issue aside from the packaging is that no matter how much or how long you shake the bottle for, it still leaves little globs of hardened product all over your face. I made the mistake on of using this as a finishing spray without double checking my fresh beat before stepping out. I had constant stares not only for being beautiful, but for the little spf globs that were akin to lint balls all over my face.The concept is amazing, but this product just doesn‚Äôt deliver. I gave it an extra star because I just love the brand and will continue to use unseen sunscreen when I go make up free

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: This is the worst setting spray ever! Maybe it has potential as a sunscreen, but I barely can wear it as it‚Äôs not matte as it advertised and it‚Äôs not fixing your makeup, it‚Äôs melting your makeup. I bought it to refresh my sunscreen during the day on top of my makeup, but I can use it only without makeup. So what the point? On bare face I can just re-apply my normal sunscreen, for that I don‚Äôt need ‚Äòfancy‚Äô spray. Plus it smells horrible. Going back to Milani setting spray with SPF.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text:
The concept of a SPF that you can reapply by misting is great, really! & I really wanted to like this product.

First & foremost, it‚Äôs marketed as ‚Äúmatte‚Äù, but even after shaking the bottle for a minute or so, it felt & looked greasy. Plus, it stung my eyes. After an hour or so, I was extra oily.

I wanted to give it a second chance, so I used the Unseen Sunscreen (which I love, 5/5 stars) & applied light makeup. When it was time to reapply SPF, I found that the nozzle leaked in my bag, & my purse smelled like it, & all my items were greasy/oily. Half of the product was gone. The nozzle wasn‚Äôt loose at all, but still somehow leaked.

I think this product has potential. Just needs a few tweaks. But as of right now, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it at all for my fellow combo/oily people.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_title: This is not it at all
review_text: This was the worst product I‚Äôve tried. It‚Äôs not a fine mist spray and the formula leaves your skin feeling sticky and super shiny. Definitely returning this.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text:

The 1oz version has a WAY BETTER nozzle that sprays more consistently and works with the way they advise you to spray your face in a circular motion. The 3.4oz is a great value but the 1oz packaging works better ESPECIALLY if you plan to use this over makeup and worry about it ruining it. 

Personally I like this sunscreen and on a hot day the scent is refreshing and cooling and I don‚Äôt even like rosemary. I‚Äôm on Tretinoin and it doesn‚Äôt sting my skin or leave it irritated. And it doesn‚Äôt leave you looking ghostly or casket ready!
Lastly, this doesn‚Äôt sting my eyes but it does taste weird. So hold your breath and tuck your lips in when applying like they state on the packaging!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_title: Love it, but have to leave it
review_text:
As much as I LOVE this product, I can‚Äôt get over the money I‚Äôve lost because every. single. time. the pump malfunctions. Because I loved the formulation so much, for years I‚Äôve repurchased hoping that supergoop would fix this issue, especially since it seems to be fairly common, but I‚Äôve been disappointed each time. 
Another sunscreen brand finally came out with a similar product and that pump has been working like a dream.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_title: Try anything else- NOT worth it.
review_text: I was so excited by the concept, could not have been more let down. Not only was it an intense stream even holding the bottle as far away as I could, but it was outrageously greasy. I didn't think I'd gotten it in my hair, but it looked like I hadn't washed my hair in days (right after a shower). I tried setting it with powder anyway, just to see, even though it's supposed to BE a setting product. Well, even with powder, my face turned into a complete grease ball after as little as two hours mostly indoors. My face makeup was completely sliding around on my face, and when I tried to gently blot away some of the intense grease, it just came completely off. I don't understand how they call it a "setting" mist- for me it acted more like a makeup remover. I really don't understand how it has so many positive reviews, because I can't imagine this product working well for anyone. I have seen some comments/reviews saying that people having issues should shake it more, but I shook the bottle vigorously for at least 10 seconds. I really feel like I gave this product more than enough chance at success and it still majorly disappointed.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: Good concept but I expected it to mist onto my face and it just squirted so I had to rub it in. Was hoping to be able to use it over my makeup mid-day.

It‚Äôs not really a mist, it‚Äôs more like a spray. Which does NOT apply evenly. I immediately poured the contents of this bottle into my urban decay setting spray and that was much better. It also kinda stings when applied, but switching the bottle helped. And it does kinda leaves a greasy ‚Äúglow‚Äù and it feels greasy too. It‚Äôs not that bad. I just wish they could improve the formula and the sprayer nozzle for sure is sub-par.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_title: it works as a refreshing SPF spray.
review_text: I liked it more than I thought I would based off the reviews. The market is still so small for this type of product but I am determined to reapply my SPF as the sun only is getting more intense this summer so I picked it up. The scent is a bit shocking in its intensity and isn‚Äôt really necessary in my opinion, but the sunscreen works well as a refreshing spray. It‚Äôs not the finest most in the world but frankly I didn‚Äôt expect it to be. I want to be able to throw this in my purse and roam about town, and give myself a quick touch up on the sunscreen and refresh my skin. I think this accomplishes that. I will say I would not rely on this as a way to extend your makeup- for me, it made my skin extra dewy and my makeup never seemed to dry back down. I definitely would transfer. For an oily girl like myself that‚Äôs a new feeling since I rely on powder so much‚Ä¶ I might this on the go with a powder puff afterward and see if it affects the over-dewiness. That being said it did not make my makeup melt or come off, and it actually did refresh it nicely. No white spots like others have complained. It‚Äôs nice and undetectable!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: I wanted to like this because I wanted to combine spf with a setting spray. one less product right? first, the spray is not even. And be careful, cuz after i used this the first time, i almost slipped on my bathroom floor. Any spray that gets on the floor is like coating your floor in oil. I will not be buying again. I DO recommend the standard sephora setting spray. I guess I'll have to find an additional SPF spray to use ontop of THAT.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: This product actually wasn‚Äôt as oily as I was anticipating. I was great to just spray on and go. But for the love of‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt open your eyes. I see some people complain about it stinging your eyes. Simple solution there folks!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text:
The bad reviews on this item are dramatic. It‚Äôs literally spray in sunscreen and works that way. I wore it over makeup and it melted down perfectly. I think perhaps it doesn‚Äôt play well with some products. 

For reference I had put on daytime skin care earlier in the day. It included the fresh deep hydration toner,  real complexion‚Äôs hyaluron skin essence, a very light layer byroe‚Äôs fog renewal oil and murad‚Äôs oil and pore control mattifier sunscreen. This was all over 2 hours before I put on my makeup hence the need for the reapplication of sun screen. 

I was definitely a bit more dewy in complexion after applying but I experienced no separation, the smell was very mild, and I waited until it dries to no burning eyes. I will definitely be purchasing this product for as long as they make it. Being able to apply sunscreen over my make changes the game.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: You have to shake it before you spray it.  When you do that, liquid leaks from the sprayer top.  I mean A LOT leaks out.  I've been rubbing the extra on the backs of my hands but I feel like it's wasted product and now the bottle is slippery and my hands are slippery.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_title: No instructions - how do they get away with that?
review_text: I think it's okay, but wow....there were NO instructions. How are we supposed to use this stuff? We're talking sun damage on faces. SuperGoop failed on this one.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text:
I needed to figure out a waterproof make up routine for the summer. That wasn't the hard part as a lot of brands do that, but I noticed my face didn't have that healthy glow when I was using all the waterproof stuff. I decided to add this in order to 1) really set my make up as I do water sports and 2) give my face more radiance. While the idea is great -- a water proof setting spray that has SPF, the execution was lacking. These are my two main complaints:
1) The bottle leaks. It's not a torrent, but liquid does seep out so that the whole thing becomes oily and hard to handle. Not to mention it wastes.
2) The sprayer is not fine enough. The liquids comes out in small droplets instead of a fine mist. It lands on my face and leaves tiny shiny dots all over. 
I would buy this again if I can figure out how to put it in a better bottle, but I will be looking for a different one in the meantime.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: I liked the application but did not like the oily texture nor the chemical smell of it and it made my hair greasy if it got to it

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: The spray nozzle is horrible, not a fine mist. It goes on super oily and totally smudges my mascara and doesn‚Äôt sit well under mask. I‚Äôll still use it just not over make up. Not worth it.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_title: DO NOT GET THIS. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.
review_text:
This product is horrible. Do not believe those reviews that say "incentivized", they are lying! I can't believe this product has 4 stars. 
It's extremely oily, i sprayed it and obviously pushed my hair back and yet, the tiny drops i got on my hair made my hair so oily that i had to wear a hat i had in my car.
My face was legit dripping oil, the spray is too thick (not a mist) so you get drops that when touched feel like pure oil sitting on your face. 
Take make it worse, the bottle was dripping into my purse and made a big mess.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: Liked that this was light weight and long lasting. Used while hiking and didn‚Äôt have to reapply for 2 hours. A bit more expensive than what I would normally use as a daily cream unless I was regularly outside.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: Bought this last minute for a trip to Europe once I noticed the forecast was going to be extra sunny. I wanted something travel size and quick and easy to reapply between site seeing and country hopping. This product ticked those boxes. The application could use some work. The spray nozzle requires a bit too much pressure to get a decent spray but the mist itself is fine. I found the smell to be quite offensively strong/almost chemically but it does fade and is an issue for all of 5 seconds. On my face the product felt a tad bit greasy but I‚Äôve experienced worse. I do feel that it did a good job setting my makeup. After full days of touring and power walking in 70-80 degree weather my makeup did not shift. I was able to do some evening touch ups right on top of my existing face and head out for the night. Overall I rate this highly in comparison to what is currently available on the market for facial spf sprays and will continue to use it.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: Seeing a lot of negative reviews talking about how it gets in your eyes or how it doesn‚Äôt spray evenly, but the directions say to spray in your hands and pat into your face (like any sunscreen). You should never be spraying sunscreen directly onto your face because of course it will get in your eyes and be uneven. When used correctly this product is great and perfect for reapplying on top of makeup.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40

The other issue is the smell. Before reading the ingredients for rosemary and mint, I thought it smelled like bug spray. The rosemary is overpowering and if you get this in your eyes it burns. I honestly don‚Äôt know how this product got released.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: I wish I could give this 0stars. As an esthetician I‚Äôm willing to give any spf a try especially one as easy to apply as this, however‚Ä¶ this is the absolute worst! Firstly, why on earth would you put spearmint in a facial mist/spray?! It actually burned more than getting sand in my eyes.. Secondly, if this is supposed to be a makeup resetting spray why is there SO MUCH OIL?! Literally completely melted my makeup off after applying 2 layers which seems like to me it defeats the purpose. And lastly again, why the mint? A HUGE NO FOR ME, PLEASE REFORMULATE!!!!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: Supergoop gifted me this gorgeous products. It's so lightweight. Absorbed quickly. Never irritated my eyes . Very convenient for travel. You can use it any where any time. It's became one of my favorite supergoop products. They always amazed me  .

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-(Re)setting Refreshing Mist SPF 40
review_text: I bought this product on a whim and I gotta say, the negative reviews don't make sense to me. This product is great! I used it after applying most of my makeup, but before mascara. Then I went and applied my favorite mascara combo. Within minutes, my mascara had smudged all over my cheeks and under eyes. I will still try this product when I‚Äôm not wearing any makeup at all, but this will not work as a setting spray over makeup for me!

review_text: Tabir mentari yang tidak sebagus botol berwarna biru. Tidak sesuai untuk kulit super berminyak. Kalau kulit berminyak tahap biasa masih okay sahaja jika menggunakan tabir mentari ini. Lepas ni saya tidak akan beli lagi kecuali formula diubah lebih cair seperti tabir mentari botol biru.

review_text:
Wanted to love this but it‚Äôs literally unusable. This SPF pilled worse than anything I‚Äôve EVER tried in my life. Not only is this annoying and strange to look at, but it also means you‚Äôre not getting the full protection of the SPF!! SPF35 is not that high to begin with so definitely don‚Äôt use this without some other form of sun protection. 
I‚Äôve read that the pilling can happen if you use water-based products underneath and that oil-based products would combine with it better - tried that as well and it made a slight difference but there is was still noticeable pilling. And as soon as I tried to layer on any makeup, we were back to square one with the whole thing pilling right back off. 
2 stars are only because if you do manage to get it on and get it to stay by some miracle, it does definitely fill and blur pores, but words out on whether or not that‚Äôs really the best thing for your skin.

review_title: Not satified after one month's of use.
review_text: At first, I thought this was the best sunscreen with a luxury texture and non-shiny finish. But after a month of daily use, I found three main problems- 1. If I want to keep using my favorite serum or moisturizer, this spf won't work with them. 3. I got sunburn even after I apply a generous amount. Maybe the spf is on the lower end and I'm in sunny California, anyway, I got sunburn twice when using this product. So now I dare only to use it when I work at home. And because of the high price, I won't buy it again due to those reasons. Test it yourself, don't be fooled or so thrilled at the first time when you apply it! It will seem and smell amazing initially..

unique_id: TATCHA-Silken Pore Perfecting Sunscreen Broad Spectrum SPF 35 PA+++
review_title: Figured out how to stop it from pilling
review_text:
I was almost going to return this because the first few times I used it I experienced a lot of pilling on certain areas of the face. But I also noticed that on the areas it didn't pill, I had the best of both worlds -- gentle zinc SPF protection and a bit of radiance. I also really liked how makeup applies so smoothly over this sunscreen, because some zinc sunscreens can leave a chalky feel that makes foundation look too pale. Not so with this one!

Anyway, because the instructions on the product recommend layering it over a moisturizer, and because it's the dead of winter and I have drier skin, I needed to figure out what would work well with this. Turns out that a few drops of a face oil applied first work out great! No pilling at all, not even a tiny bit. I'm so pleased. Previously I was using an oil-based moisturizer that didn't even have silicones in it, but for whatever reason the Tatcha didn't agree with it. If you like face oils, I highly recommend using one underneath this SPF.

Given the expensive price tag, I expected more from this product. Overall, while application is smooth, the utility of the product does not justify its price.

review_text:
It might protect you from the sun and there‚Äôs no white cast, hence the 1 star. 
I‚Äôm pretty sensitive to the heaviness of sunscreen, especially on my face and I do not prefer the tactile sensation of applying this one. It continues to feel heavy, just like when you first apply it, long after it sinks into the skin. 
Initially, it smelled really nice (I like sunscreen smell) which was why I kept trying to wear it even though it doesn‚Äôt really smooth pores nor does makeup look very nice over top.

I don‚Äôt have more blackheads because of it which I love! My complain is the hefty price with the small amount of product and small Spf % I wish they can come out with another that is am spf 50. I bought this with the sephora sale, I think I will wait to repurchase until the next sale in the fall to better justify the amount/ price. review_title: excellent for dry sensitive skin (retinol users)
review_text: My new favorite spf. I just wish it were a 50 but I haven‚Äôt had any sunburn so 40 must get the job done. I have skin prone to dryness. I‚Äôve used Prescription Tretinoin for many years now and it has that affect. I love that this sunscreen replaced any moisturizer I had to use for day so it lightens the load and amount of products I had to use. It‚Äôs a light layer that packs a punch with continuous hydration. Now I use a serum (Lauder Advanced Night Repair, and eye serum, an eye moisturizer and then this on top. It is perfect and I hope they never stop making it. I don‚Äôt need primers under makeup if I wear it. It moisturizes and keeps my skin feeling comfortable all day. Have not have any issues with breakouts. The scent is light and reminds me of soft honey. It dissipates quickly and I never notice again once I‚Äôve applied. It‚Äôs gentle enough that I‚Äôve had zero issues with it stinging or burning my eyes. Now that I think about it I haven‚Äôt had any burning when I rub my eyes. I don‚Äôt know that this would be ideal for anyone with normal or normal to combo and oily skin. Maybe in the winter for normal. But if you have truly dry skin ( mine is also sensitive and prone to redness) this is the one. For my neck and chest I use Super Goop Play. It‚Äôs a 50 SPF and is working out great. I also use that one on shoulders and arms as needed. Love this line.

The price is steep for 30ml, hence the 4.5 stars. I would continue to repurchase if I can‚Äôt find a replacement.

review_text: I bought this because it has a higher SPF.  However, this product leaves a layer of white cast on my face. It would probably be fine for someone with fair skin.

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++
review_title: Definitely a NO for medium skin tones!
review_text: At first I thought it was tinted, bcs it was written somewhere before this. I'm always a fan of mineral sunscreens as I have sensitive skin. Tinted is always better, for me at least. This sunscreen not only leaves a white cast, but more like a bluish/purple white cast on my medium olive skin. I say definitely skip this if you're not WHITE or if you have a combo-oily skin bcs this definitely leaves a greasy film.

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++
review_text: Definitely leaves a white cast. You really have to spread it and spread it and spread it to not have that white cast. For the price, the amount of product is... very little. It is nothing to write home about. Look, it probably works as a sunscreen but it will clog your pores, leave a white cast and make you feel not so great. Do not recommend.

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++
review_text: it's an excellent sun block. recently went to the beach when it was extremely hot. the areas where I did not put the sunblock was sunburnt badly. and the areas where I did put the sunblock were fine. it might cause a white cast on your face though.

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++
review_text: A decent sunblock plus skincare product that provides skin protection while promoting healing. Was out in nature while using this all over my face and body and not a single tan line or burnt skin. Can‚Äôt use on a daily basis because it‚Äôs too oily for my skin type‚Äîcauses acne over time.

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++
review_text: I'm not sure if I like this sunscreen. It leaves a greasy look on application, and definitely leaves a white cast on my brown skin...but it does subside somewhat after 5-10 minutes of application. If I were to avoid the white cast completely, I'd have to use very little product and that would beat the purpose of using a sunscreen. Also, it stings the eye if you sweat and the sweat gets in your eye...have learnt it the hard way after I wore it to the gym and my eyes started watering because of the sting!

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++

review_title: love the product but be mindful

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++
review_text: Because of recent pandemic, though have to wear mask everyday but still need to look good when you take off the mask. Also because of the hot weather, I wear less foundation nowadays. This Clinique sunscreen works great on my skin, making my skin looks really translucent and young! Non sticky! No white cast! Just sit perfectly!

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++
review_text:
The reason I bought Clinique Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF50+++ because it is safe for use around the eye area. Living in Malaysia, I am looking for a sunscreen that protects my skin from harmful UVA rays without clogging it and also treat my skin from pigmentation such as dark spots, sun spots and freckles. I love putting the sunscreen after my skincare, either when I go out or when I stay at home, works well alone or under the makeup. It feels barely-there and does not leave a white cast.  I can see the pigmentations on my face got reduced tremendously, my pores do not look clogged at all and the best thing is my skin looks instantly brightens and even out skin tone. 

The sunscreen is in a gorgeous white bottle with a small nozzle that disperses the right amount of sunscreen.  Easy to carry around and a must-have in my handbag. Worth every sen!!

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++
review_text: After trying so many different brands of sunblock I still love this one as it doesn't give a oily feel and the no colour sunblock is definitely a plus point. Price is on the high side however it works really well.

unique_id: CLINIQUE-Even Better Dark Spot Defense SPF 50/PA++++

High uva/uvb protection is of course a major plus. Took half a star off because it does leave a white cast. Not really noticeable on my paler skin, but might be an issue for someone with a darker skin tone.

review_title: It was a no until it wasn't!
review_text: Ok, so I understand all the criticism but hear me out! I use it a certain way and it's been working wonders for my skin. I'll put the whole dollop on my hand and blend it like crazy (yes, this is a bit wasteful), then I delicately place this on my eyes and nose - basically center of my face outwards. It not only blends well but it brightens/conceals any dark spots and evens things out giving me this luminous glow. Better than any tint SPF I have used! 40spf, mineral, and EWG-safe. For naysayers, I think blending it very well in the hand and then applying will help with the crepey skin effect.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: When I walked in and asked where this was the employee said they dont carry anything like it, that shouldve warned me not to buy it. All but one bottle also had already expired. Took me 10 months to go through this, it does not work under any makeup, regardless of how I prepped my under eyes, I have normal skin - bit dry in the winter. The only way I could wear this was on no makeup days, and immediately after washing my face while damp. You have to stop blending at THE perfect time or it will pill up, and it looks awful midday no matter what. I found this looked the least awful in the summer, I have not one single positive to say about this product.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: Pills, dies down unpleasantly, too thick
review_text: I'd read the reviews complaining that this pills but I thought I'd risk it because nothing like sunscreen during those bright, sunny summer days, right? I regret that. It really does pill the minute you use anything other than very very gentle tapping motions or even lightly tug at the under eye area. It has a weird dry down, too, kind of patchy and powdery. Does not at all feel hydrating or moisturizing or nourishing. I can't even imagine trying to go over this with makeup. I guess the slight pigment means that you can get away with only this if you're feeling a natural kind of day, but I'd dread using concealer over this product. The consistency is super thick though and it does that thing where it dries in a gloopy, thick ball and jams up the nozzle where the product comes out of. I don't think I'll purchase this again.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: Do not recommend at all! Peels like crazy no matter what you do. Bad formula

review_title: Goopy, Not in a Good Way
review_text: I liked this product when I first tried it, so I don't know if they've changed the formula or what but I am now not a fan. You know how a dried clump forms in a pump product you haven't used in a while? Well this forms one Every. Single. Day. Just like it says on the lid. So every morning I have to pry a clump out of the product before I can use it. I would guess a significant amount goes to waste because of that. This product also does not play well with others - especially hyaluranic acid. No matter how long I let my skin "dry" after applying, this eye cream pills up. I end up having to wipe away pills with a damp wash cloth, which I am pretty sure renders applying an SPF product to my eyes useless. I wish SuperGoop would offer the old eye SPF product in the tube again. This one is unfortunately a hard pass for me.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I'm so glad to see a sunscreen that's safe for eyes. This is one of the very few, and I like it fine. But the packaging is terrible. What's with all this "style over substance" packaging? The lid is not airtight, so the product dries out at the tip of the pump and forms a little plug. So you waste a bit every time you use it. And, you there's no way of knowing how much is left. So you have to run out before you can restock. I used to be in marketing for a packaged good, and worked with the packaging designers to find a design that was both functional and beautiful. It's not that hard. And, this is not the only expensive cosmetics product that has terrible packaging. I feel like I keep writing the same review for different cosmetics products.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++

review_text: i really enjoy this eye cream. it‚Äôs great to use during the day, for its obvious sun protection benefit and it being lightweight. i have super oily skin and haven‚Äôt found it to run into my eyes throughout the day, which is a plus (rare for me). you need to warm the product up between your ring fingers before applying and tap to apply instead of rub. i have not experienced any pilling when i do both of the aforementioned steps. there is a bit of a tint that illuminates the eyes but it is a bit shimmery so keep that in mind. make sure to tap it out well at the edges so there is no harsh line between the eye cream and the rest of your face.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: This product confirmed for me that my skin simply can‚Äôt tolerate zinc. I have to use a chemical sunscreen on my face to avoid irritation and dryness but I always felt bad that my eyes were left unprotected. I thought I‚Äôd give this a try as it‚Äôs the only eye cream I could find with SPF. I thought the tint was great, it really brightened my eyes and it even had a little sheen to it to make my eyes pop. A few hours later this felt drying, heavy and irritating. I ended up rubbing my eyes because of the irritation and the product came off my eyes in large pills. I can‚Äôt imagine that this would work under makeup whatsoever. unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Bright-Eyed 100% Mineral Eye Cream SPF 40 PA+++

review_text: Absolutely love this product and will keep buying! At first I thought it was really thick but I am used to it now and it doesn‚Äôt bother me. The brightening effect is great! I don‚Äôt use concealer or anything under my eyes but I love the brightening. It‚Äôs not too much - at first it looks very light but then it soaks in a bit and looks more natural. I love that I can still feel the cream on my eye area hours later after applying. Keeps my eye area moisturized all day! My eyes are extremely sensitive to sunscreen and if the sunscreen gets too close my eyes burn so badly - so usually in the summer I have to choose sunburn or eye burning from the spf. This product allows me to get right up to the edge of my eye lids and there is no burning! Love it!

It also pills really easily. I just waited a full hour after vitamin c application in order to put this on, and even still, the pulling is awful. I am bummed this didn‚Äôt work out.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text:
I was looking for a moisturizer cum sunscreen for the face as I didn't wanna put so much products in the morning / during the day, so I ordered one since the review was pretty good.¬†
So basically the texture is slightly thicker than a moisturizer but it is not oily. The scent is a tad like sunscreen but you will get used to it. Good purchase.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: I'm not a fan of the too-many-steps face regimen, so this product fits me well. It has a light texture for an spf product, non sticky or oily, has a wonderful smell, absorb quickly and hydrates very well. leave my skin soft and protected.¬†made my morning hassle-free. love this.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: This is a good basic SPF moisturiser for the day. I hate wearing sunscreen during work hours because the smell is quite strong, and the texture is often too creamy for me. This is a really nice light textured moisturiser, and doesn't smell of sun cream. The packaging could be improved to 50ml as I find there are a lot of other products in the same price range which offer the 10ml extra.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: Quite expensive for the amount you get but it is good for sensitive skin, moisturises well and leaves my skin feeling soft. Is also a good make-up base but I admit that it makes my skin (I have dry cheeks and an oily t-zone) very shiny after a few hours. Also sad that it's supposed to be reapplied every few hours but it's a good product if you need a basic SPF moisturiser!¬†

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: I am searching for a physical sunscreen with decent spf, more natural ingredients and non-oliy finish. I think this product meet all the requirements for a sunscreen. Because it is not oily, you need to apply moisturizer under it. BTY, it can be removed easily which is a plus.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text:
This is one of the better sunscreens I have used thus far. It absorbs well into the skin. This is definitely suitable for Singapore hot and humid weather. Can't comment how effective it is though.¬†

Recommended! Give it a shot!

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: I find it just a normal moisturizer with uv protection. It is not too oily nor too dry, and has no strong smell, works as what it is supposed to be but I probably won't go back for it again. will try another brand.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_title: Feels like a sunblock and is one
review_text: You know when you squeeze out from a Nivea moisturizer bottle and go, "it looks like milk." Well, it is the same with this sunblock and moisturizer rolled into one. It doesn't make your skin feel heavy or gluey even thought I applied it after the "in transit camera close-up". The sun is really doing crazily these days, so better protect yourself before it is too late.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text:
Smells way better than your average sunscreen and doesn't have that sticky, oily feel. And the pump bottle is very easy to use and mess free.
¬†I am coming to love This Works products a lot! So glad I picked this up from the 30% sale!¬†

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: In need of SPF coverage for my face. This is a great buy! Love the scent and the light texture. Leaving your skin feeling soft and protected. Will definitely buy again when it runs out! Highly recommended for those having Sensitive skin. This works for me!¬†

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: I bought this moisturizer because it comes with SPF. I use it over my SK II stempower and they work well together for my sensitive skin when I'm out in the sun for long. It is not sticky and is very light. Will repurchase!

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: I'm in love with this moisturizer! I think it's a perfect blend of moisturizer and SPF! The smell is awesome(mild and not strongly scented) and the packaging in genius! I like that it's so handy and it's just moist enough for my combination skin. It is a basic moisturizer SPF though, so if you want more added properties, use a serum.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: I'm put off by the smell! After application, I didn't break out.. BUT as a 2-in-1, the moisturizer didn't work! My skin dried out. I think feels more of a sunblock than a moisturizer. It's quite thick and oily to apply, I had to set it or I'd be walking out with so much shimmer on my face its enough to fry an egg. Packaging wise, its not as convenient as they've mentioned! Maybe to fly but it's still too big to travel around with (Though with that size, it's considered more affordable/ worth it.) It couldn't stand on my vanity table. No to smell, no to application and no to packaging. Upset with this purchase! :( Can I return this please, Luxola??¬†

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_title: Finally, an SPF moisturizer without the Oily feel!
review_text: Finally, a moisturizer with SPF but without the "oily" feel! Encouraged by the successful trial of 2 other In Transit products, i decided to go for my 3rd In Transit product and again, this brand did not disappoint me. I did not develop any breakouts. It does not feel "hot" on the skin. It does not feel oily nor heavy. I would say it really suits my combination skin in the humid Singapore climate.

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: I'm instantly loving this product! It doesn't give you a white streak like any other SPF products. The texture is very light so it absorbs to your skin nicely. It's not greasy and it can be a perfect base to put under your makeup. I can feel that it really works as a moisturizer and hydrates the skin very well. I'm definitely going to purchase it! Highly recommended..

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: a bit afraid at first because I thought this will make my skin feel greasy, but it's not! easily absorbed and left my skin feeling soft. I used this as my everyday SPF and lotion. You should get this if you've been looking for moisturizer lotion with SPF.¬†

unique_id: THIS WORKS-In Transit Skin Defence SPF30
review_text: This sunblock is easy to apply and can also be applied over makeup easily. It feels moisturising and does not dry up my skin (although my skin tends to be oily). I am still testing it for its anti-aging and anti-oxidation effects but these are still early days. At the moment, I think this is a great buy as it is not greasy and is relatively cheaper compared to other brands.
