unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Lipscreen SPF 40
review_text: Was excited to get a lip sunscreen when I found supergoop‚Äôs. The downside for me is that when I apply too much of it,it‚Äôs bitter and has this taste in my mouth.You have to apply an appropriate amount yet not knowing if it‚Äôs enough for sun protection.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Lipscreen SPF 40
review_title: It tastes terrible. Don't buy it girl.
review_text:
The title says it all. Even though I read reviews from other people saying it tasted bad, I still purchased it because of various reasons (how it can block the suncreen etc.). 

And I was wrong. After applying it, everything was fine until I drank water. I could taste it immediately.

I can't say if this product works wonder, but the taste is so so bad and I hate it.

The only pro about it is that it gives you that shiny look, when combined with a chemical sunscreen.

Won't buy it again.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Lipscreen SPF 40

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Lipscreen SPF 40

Secondly, on the tube it says ‚Äòif swallowed, get medical help or contact poison control center immediately‚Äô. Really? It‚Äôs a lip product, which means you ingest a little of it every time you wear it.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Lipscreen SPF 40

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Lipscreen SPF 40

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Clean Screen Sensitive Skinscreen SPF30
review_text: Good product that is lightweight and absorbs easily. No sunburn on my cruise and exploration journey. Have tested the sunscreens with higher spf but those are sticky and harder to absorb by the skin.

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Clean Screen Sensitive Skinscreen SPF30
review_text:
Pros - feels comfortable on the skin, didn't make me breakout. 
Cons - makes my hair super rough even if just a little product touches my hair (never used a sunscreen that did this), takes a while to absorb into my skin, stains my face mask, leaves an ugly sheen on my face 
Bottomline - i prefer asian sunscreens. I will not repurchase this.

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Clean Screen Sensitive Skinscreen SPF30
review_text: Let's see. First I appreciate that this is a fragrance and alcohol free sunscreen. However, it comes with a tint which is a real pain to blend out. It takes me about 10 mins and by that time, I get conscious about how much product is being transferred onto my fingertips. The white cast (I'm a medium to dark brown shade) doesn't disappear over time but kind of just stays put on your skin. It's not transfer proof either so I have to be careful when I'm wearing anything white. I'm down to finishing the tube and I'll never repurchase it again.

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Clean Screen Sensitive Skinscreen SPF30
review_text:
I've always wanted a sunscreen that doesnt have an oily/greasy finish to it, and this one does the trick for my dry/sensitive skin!
Will be repurchasing soon!

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Clean Screen Sensitive Skinscreen SPF30
review_text: Goes on like a light lotion, no white cast or any pasty drag. Very very impressed. Works well with my makeup. Happy that Sephora brought this brand in, I was planning to get it shipped from Australia so saved on shipping fees.

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Clean Screen Sensitive Skinscreen SPF30
review_text: Was looking for a thicker sunscreen and this is close to what I was looming for. Great protection but the reason for the 4 starts is due to the smell. it has a plastic smell. Does anyone have idea if it is supposed to smell this way?

unique_id: ULTRA VIOLETTE-Clean Screen Sensitive Skinscreen SPF30
review_text: The texture of this spf is on the thicker, more opaque side, but it‚Äôs good for preventing burns especially if we‚Äôre applying these on children. We‚Äôll be using this one up and repurchase when necessary.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: Love the packaging of this product. The consistency is ok but it leaves a white cast like any other sunscreen. I would reorder this if the other options of sunscreen from Supergoop is out of stock.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_title: Best mineral sunscreen I have tried
review_text: For being a mineral sunscreen, this is the best I have used! It still has that mineral feel of being a bit heavy and slight white cast look on my skin, but it's still the thinnest and most easily spreadable mineral sunscreen I have found so far. If you have to have a mineral sunscreen, this is a great one to have. I still prefer chemical sunscreens to this one, but while I have to wear mineral sunscreen for the time being I will continue to use this one. With this mineral sunscreen it feels a bit more drying on my dry skin so now I use moisturizer under my sunscreen as opposed to chemical sunscreens I have used that moisturize adequately on their own.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I‚Äôve used 2 bottles of this sunscreen and it works fine! It gives me a brighter skin complexion. However, the only downside is the SPF count is low. So, multiple applications are needed especially for those who are staying in a hot and humid country

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I am someone who was looking for  a subscription that I could wear every day without having any white cast as I have brown skin color and this was the perfect sunscreen that I bought from Sephora and it really helped my skin to heal and it did not have any white cast, so I really like this sunscreen. It‚Äôs perfect for every day use even with or without make up.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I bought this sunscreen after reviews from influencers and have been using it for over a year. It works just fine as any sunscreen does, however it smells quite weird straight out of the tube and can leave my skin with bumps needing extra exfoliation at the end of the day. I wondered why that was considering I have no issue with zinc oxide. Well, it's because it contains Butyloctyl Salicylate, which is just the unregulated version of octisalate, a common chemical sunscreen. Because it is unregulated there is no dose limit so no way to know how much is in it. I do appreciate that there is a high % of zinc oxide, however this is in no way a 100% mineral sunscreen as advertised.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_title: Terrible, smells bad, cause breakouts, and peels!
review_text:
This product is terrible! The smell is really bad and makes me feel uncomfortable to apply to my skin, the texture is weird and hard to smooth out on my skin.
Even worse, I started having break outs after using it, and it starts peeling in the middle of the day and make me look like I just got a lot dandruff on my face!
Absolutely the worse! Throwing it away and will not buy from this brand again!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I look grey after applying. The texture is okay, I don't look greasy but I look grey. I tried to rub it in, I waited 20 minutes for my skin to warm the product up but still look grey. I have to put moisturizer on top of it (making it less effective) to get some of my color back.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: Thankfully it worked on my skin. It gives a slight white Color but after a while it settles down. Another super goop face Sun screen thats worth the money.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text:
The best mineral sunscreen I‚Äôve used. It does leave some white cast when I first apply it, BUT it goes away or just get blended in my skin somehow. I don‚Äôt know how that works exactly, but my skin looks natural in 20-30 mins after applying. I have medium skin with a little olive tone. I saw some comments about it not working on darker skin though.
Most mineral sunscreens leave white cast, so if you don‚Äôt want any of that, you might want to look at chemical sunscreens. 
No piling issue for me.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I bought the mineral trial size kit. I've been in search of a mineral sunscreen that a) didn't irritate my skin and b) was easier to blend in/not leave a terrible caked on white cast that required me to put makeup over it to look like a human again. My face is all of a sudden mega sensitive to sunscreens and several that are high end mineral ones irritated it so much it itched and burned for days even after patch testing for a week. So I'm on day 3 of my patch testing now,wearing it on my forehead and half of my face and so far, no irritation! I love the application. Yes, it leaves a white/bluish cast for a minute as you put it on but it is minimal in comparison to most other mineral sunscreens. Also,it is easy to blend in and does not feel heavy. I'm going to push on with my 5-7 day of patch testing before I purchase full size but I have high hopes. I have not noticed the smell of it at all yet, makes me wonder if some people are getting older product that's starting to go bad, same with those who say it pills on them significantly. So far no pilling, but I have not put makeup over it as that was my first goal. SPF to throw on and walk the dog without a full face of makeup in 90 degree humid summer weather.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I think I've tried about every mineral sunscreen out there and this one wins. It's lightweight and does not irritate my dry, eczema prone skin. It seems to even out my competition a bit with no white cast. I lightly moisturizer first, finish getting ready and then apply this about 15 minute later. I feel protected and don't walk around feeling like I have a mask on my face. Yeah! Also, it doesn't travel and end up in my eyes or neck lines like others I've tried. It's a bit pricey but my skin is worth it!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: Sunscreen leaves whitecast. Needs longer time to absorb into oily skin. Has a strong fragrance. But does not make my skin breakout. A bit too pricey for a sunscreen which needs to be used daily.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I received this product as a free sample and its smelled really weird when I used it on my face.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: Adult Caucasian male. Love this sunscreen. Once it‚Äôs sat for a minute, the white cast goes away. Its the last step in my skincare routine. I do not wear makeup. This is a 5 star non-toxic sunscreen.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text:
I have oily combination skin. Finding a sunscreen can be difficult sometimes when all the sunscreens I‚Äôve tried have left me feeling so greasy and they leave a white cast. This sunscreen feels like you‚Äôre putting on a very light weight moisturizer and leaves 0 white cast. I 
will say it‚Äôs not my favorite smell only because I think it smells like peanut butter and I‚Äôm not a fan but everything else exceeds my expectations of a sun screen.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: No white cast, absorbed well, slightly funny smell. But I would choose this over the zinc screen and happy to have found a mineral sunscreen that feels more like a lotion!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_title: Gets absorbed, no white cast on light brown skin
review_text:
Been trying a lot of mineral sunscreens recently since Replenix discontinued my favorite one, and I really like this one. Surprisingly, despite the lack of tint, there is no white cast on my light brown skin (my tone is like Halle Berry). It gets absorbed nicely (after about 5 mins) and feels a bit tacky (which I don't mind) - it is not just sitting on the surface of my skin so it does not collect in my fine lines and does not just rub off when I touch my face. 

It does leave a slight shine but it's way less than all the other mineral sunscreens I have tried (except the Supergoop Matte Sunscreen which has no shine at all). I can use a generous layer of this on my face and know I am protected well from the sun without looking like a super shiny ghost.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30

It‚Äôs a dream to reapply too. I spend the day outside during peak sun hours sometimes and I reapply this every 2 hours and I experience no pilling and no added greasyness that some spf can get. At the end of the day my face looks glowy and radiant but feels like i have a moisturizer on. It is slightly sticky for maybe 20-30 minutes after applying but well worth it for me. I did see some reviews talking about the smell and it‚Äôs really not that bad these people must use heavily fragranced products because this smells earthy and natural to me. unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I truly love this product. I am obsessive with skincare and SPF. I am the person that asks everyone if they have worn their SPF today. I have super sensitive skin that is acne prone. If you are sensitive to smell that might bother you, but it quickly goes away (the smell is more on your hands than your face and I just wash my hands after). For a 100% mineral sunscreen, it is a great price with great ingredients. Also I love the bottle, you can just stick it in your purse and I don't feel like it is going to explode everywhere.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: This has a great texture, slightly glossy but not noticeable. It doesn‚Äôt have a smell that I can discern. Rubs in quickly and smoothly‚ÄîI‚Äôm impressed!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I pretty much exclusively use chemical sunscreens because I refuse to wear anything with a white cast, but I was excited that this mineral sunscreen claimed to be sheer. Unfortunately, when I apply the recommended amount of sunscreen to my face and neck (about 1/2 tsp) it takes forever to rub in and still leaves me with a white cast. In addition to the white cast, this sunscreen is heavy and pills a lot, especially around my eyebrows and hairline.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: I received this Mineral Sheer Sunscreen complimentary of Supergoop! I love how lightweight this feels on my skin and doesn't leave a white cast like some other sunscreens. It is also cruelty free and doesn't break out or irritate my sensitive skin. Love Supergoop!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: Having had skin issues related to past sun damage I have become quite the sunscreen junkie the past ten years or so. Mostly because I hate it and I hate wearing it, but I wear it everyday. I‚Äôm always searching for the elusive HG. This isn‚Äôt quite it, but Its pretty close and I think it‚Äôs the most innovative mineral formula to come out in several years. I am oily and I have sensitive skin. This isn‚Äôt perfectly sheer, but it‚Äôs slightly more sheer than your typical mineral type sheer sunscreen that also cheats by putting octinoxate in the formula-an ingredient that is hard for me to tolerate and is being blamed for damage to coral reefs. That this formula relies on 17.5% zinc oxide and is so unbelievably light is really remarkable. I am able to put my skincare on, follow with a layer of this, then I dab a mattifying primer on my t-zone and follow with my favorite sheer foundation and my skin just looks great. I would believe that you could layer this over a moisturizer without issues if you are drier because I did layer this over two somewhat thick serums without issue. I have to blot and powder, but not as much as with other products. My pores are not amplified at the end of the day as they normally are. It‚Äôs a pretty neutral consistency. I can‚Äôt wait to see what the brand comes out with-they really push the envelope in what I think is an important category. I read a review or two that stated this seemed like nothing special or like other sunscreens they had tried but I would like to know which because I have literally tried every option HE or drugstore, Korean, Japanese, Euro, US formulated-this is different considering the ingredients.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text:
*I received this product complimentary from Supergoop! to sample. 

This mineral Sheer Screen is exactly what it says it is. It is sheer, not completely clear. I have a lighter, Asian complexion that has a natural yellow tint to it. I was a little skeptical at first because the initial spreading of the product appears white. After rubbing it in properly though, it only left a slightly white residue, not overwhelming. The picture attached is an *immediate* before after. After about 30 minutes, the whiteness of the sunscreen calmed down even more and I spent the day without makeup feeling fine. Not too greasy, and it felt good on my sensitive skin. 

I also tried it with makeup immediately after applying, and it did not mess up my foundation color which makes this a good choice for me to wear under my makeup for work. 

Overall, I think this is a great foundation for days at the office, brunch, or casual outings. I will continue to use their other products for more heavy outdoor usage on runs, hikes, bike rides, etc.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30

Also had a greasy residue feel. Unfortunately would not recommend because I do enjoy supergoop as a brand

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Mineral Sheer Screen SPF 30
review_text: This stuff is amazing. I layer it under my makeup so I am protected from the sun. It blends in nicely to my skin. It has a sheer look to it. I love super goop. Their products are amazing. I love that the spf is 30 too.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-100% Mineral Sunscreen Mist SPF 30
review_title: Best When You Need Waterproof Staying Power
review_text: Spreadability non-existent, so wherever you put it, that's where it will stay. I have dry, eczema-prone skin, and this makes my skin feel extremely dry. But it is pretty darn waterproof, which is great for when I need that (hiking/swimming/sweating). Otherwise, I'll use other body sunscreens on a daily basis. I do wish the SPF was higher than 30. If it's already going to leave an opaque white cast anyway, then why not just raise the SPF? I also wish they'd make a body version of their mineral sheer screen (and maybe have higher SPF in them both).

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-100% Mineral Sunscreen Mist SPF 30
review_text: I love this sunscreen. It isn‚Äôt thick goopy old school zinc oxide. It‚Äôs sprays on thinly and rubs in easily and the white goes away. Yes, mineral sunscreen is white (so you need to know what you are ordering but then don‚Äôt complain it‚Äôs white - it‚Äôs mineral). I really like this one. I need mineral sunscreen because I‚Äôm so fair and this is a really easy one to spray on and use. Highly recommend.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-100% Mineral Sunscreen Mist SPF 30
review_text: This is a really great mineral sunscreen! If you know anything about zinc oxide only sunscreen than you, know it‚Äôs going to have a white cast. It‚Äôs a characteristic of zinc oxide. I have EXTREMELY sensitive skin. All chemical sunscreens make me break out. I have tried 15 different physical sunscreens in the last two years. This is one of my favorites! Not only is it waterproof, it is also lightweight and if you spray it in small areas at a time it spreads easily. Yes, you will still have a white sheen. To me, that is preferable than getting a sunburn or having hives & white pimple like bumps from chemical sunscreens. I wish I would have tried this one sooner in my search for a waterproof mineral sunscreen. It is one of the best formulations and unique formulations, I don‚Äôt know if any other mineral sprays. This makes application a breeze!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-100% Mineral Sunscreen Mist SPF 30

I put it on once, never had to reapply and didn‚Äôt get any color after an entire day on the lake (and I am very fair). Final thoughts: not worth it! There are better sunscreens out there.

review_text: I‚Äôve bought this moisturizer 3 times now. It has a weird pump dispenser that‚Äôs always getting clogged, so I end up having to take off the pump and just smack the bottle against my hand. And then I have to worry that the moisturizer will oxidize if I don‚Äôt screw the pump back on right. The design makes you waste so much product. The product itself is great if you have dry, sensitive skin and want a good amount of SPF. I never feel like it‚Äôs too heavy, though I have very naturally dry skin.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45

review_text: Fabulous sheer coverage and works well as a primer for any makeup you might wear. Love love love this product. The size of the bottle makes me feel better about buying it again. Definitely in my top 3 sunscreens.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: Very moisturizing! Scent is a bit off putting, smells a bit bad. Absorbs into the skin nicely, leaves a dewy finish, not overly greasy looking. Only downside I found with this is it ran into my eyes all day long and burned.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: White cast (I'm fair to medium) and greasy appearance. Doesn't feel like water, thats for sure. Feels and works like a run of the mill sunscreen at a laughable price. It doesn't break my skin out or leave it feeling coated in the powdery feel some sunscreens can encrusted in the face as the day wears on. Light, Non offensive scent. I will say that I use two full pumps and still feel my face get a little sore if I'm in the sun. I don't reapply though. It would ruin my makeup so this rating is for those interested in only applying sunscreen once (not recommended, but the reality for most faces.)

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: I really like this product. Wish I could give it a 3.5 instead of 3. I'd say its more of an SPF and less of a moisturizer. It has a thin, semi-creamy to liquid texture. It comes out as a light cream but then becomes more like a liquid once it warms up. Reminds me of Paula's Choice Resist Hydrating fluid SPF, but more moisturizing for sure. I have combination, sensitive skin and it works well with it. I don't know if it is an everyday moisturizer as it is marketed, but for being out all day in the sun that would be great! I hate feeling dried out by a spf for my face. I don't feel I need to use a moisturizer really with it like some other SPFs. I use my serums before and top it with this and its great for a light makeup day WFH. I sit by a window for WFH and need SPF every day. This gives me a shine/glow which I like, I know some people may not want that look. I do think this works best with a light makeup day. I wouldn't use this under a full glam look. I also haven't noticed any pilling like with some SPFs. For me, there is also not really a white-cast but I do have fairer skin though and that may not work for other skin tones. I think it takes a little time to soak in and it's not going to become matte. I like that I feel hydrated and have a little glow over feeling matte and dryer. So I'd look at that if you're not wanting to have a sheen on your skin. My one final point is that it does get into eyes easily it seems which can be annoying. But overall I really do like it and would buy again.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_title: Peter Thomas Roth Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: I love this SPF.   It goes on smoothly and feels moisturizing on the skin.  Not greasy or shiny at all.  I wear SPF 365 days a year    This one feels great on and is a nice base before applying makeup.  Love it will buy it again

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text:
I love the product inside this bottle. It's light, it doesn't smell too strongly of suncreen, it doesn't clog my pores, and it's not greasy. So great! However...

I hate the bottle itself. It's poorly designed and using it is intensely frustrating. It's not obvious whether you should try to shake the product so it ends up close to or far away from the dispenser end. The result is aggravation and waste. I'd much rather buy this in a jar or a regular squeezable tube. 

Fix the packaging and I'll gladly give this product top marks!

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: This is the best sunscreen I have ever used. It left my skin soft and there was no greasiness. This is a better moisturizer than Glamglow Moisture Trip, which is what I use at night.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: the two finger rule leaves me looking insanely oily and there‚Äôs actually no possible way i can wear the accompanying moisturizer for this Hyaluronic Hydrating line because it will always pill up no matter what I do.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: I love PTR products. But admittedly, I‚Äôm one of those middle aged women stuck in their ways, and simply like what I like. I‚Äôve used the SPF 30 Defense Moisturizer for many years, but had recently noticed a change in my skin within the t-zone. I was hesitant to try this new sunscreen, but one of the associates convinced me otherwise and honestly told me she had yet try it, but heard lots of positive feedback. So, I gave it a go... I‚Äôm glad I did. On those days when I opt to wear sunscreen it feels like nothing is on my skin. It is literally weightless. I love that! And it makes an excellent base when I do wear makeup. No more shiny t-zone. I‚Äôd give this product 10 stars if allowed. Peter Thomas Roth hit a home run with this one.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: Pills pretty bad on my skin. If it didn‚Äôt pill I would like it a lot.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_title: Peter Thomas Roth Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: I workout and sweat a lot. This product is very comfortable and it won't sting my eyes. It also keeps my skin hydrated. Definitely will buy again

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_title: Not The Same as their Lotion
review_text: I was expecting this to be the same as the ‚Äúwater drench hyaluronic lotion‚Äù that they make. It absolutely should be the same, because it shares the same name. Which is a logical assumption (and misleading on there part). The only difference should be that it contains sunscreen. I don‚Äôt see the same results using this product as I do from the moisturizer. I still have to use it until it‚Äôs gone, because it‚Äôs expensive... I was disappointed.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text:
I absolutely love this product...except for the retail price. As someone with skin that has been more combo-dry recently, I‚Äôve found I much prefer my sunscreen and moisturizer to be one product than two because I can never find a sunscreen that is moisturizing enough for me. This product is so good!! It truly does feel like a light weight water cream moisturizer that sinks into the skin like it‚Äôs nothing but doesn‚Äôt make my oily spots too shiny. I will say that as I reapply it (ALWAYS reapply every few hours!!) my skin gets super dewy and I have to blot it, I don‚Äôt mind doing this but those with oily skin might. With that being said: if you have more combo- oily to oily skin, you probably won‚Äôt like this, especially since you need to reapply this so often. Another plus is that as someone with super reactive and sensitive skin: this did not irritate me or break me out, it actually healed a breakout I was having. 

I got it as a sample in the Sephora Sun Safety kit, and while I would love to purchase the full size, I just can‚Äôt justify the price for the amount of product you get. Why so little?? It infuriates me that brands do this - this product delivers exactly what it says and more, but I won‚Äôt be buying it because I can‚Äôt afford the price given that you go through this super fast with all the reapplication. The price is why I took off a star. If you can put down the money, then absolutely invest! Otherwise, there are more affordable options at the drugstore and possibly Sephora.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_title: Peter Thomas Roth Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: I have oily skin and break out easily on my forehead. I thought I‚Äôd give this a try based on reviews. I was sold on my first bottle, currently on my second one. No white cast, goes on light like a moisturizer, & I have not broken out since adding this product to my routine. This is a must have in my daily routine.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_title: I would definitely recommend you give it a try!
review_text: So far this product has been great. I have dry acne prone skin. Finding a sunscreen that works well over other products and doesn‚Äôt pill up has been a struggle for me. This sunscreen has a unique texture that almost feels like you are applying cold water to the skin. It‚Äôs very refreshing. I haven‚Äôt really had a sunscreen I look forward to putting on everyday like this one. I‚Äôm also very picky about fragrance in my products and this particular product doesn‚Äôt seem to have any fragrance at all! I‚Äôm not sure I would recommend this to you if you have oily skin as it makes my dry skin look pretty dewy. But honestly, I love the glow. Another plus is that I haven‚Äôt seen any breakouts so far so I have my fingers crossed. It‚Äôs safe to say I will repurchase this product!

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: I first got this sunscreen in the Sephora sun sampler, and then went and bought two more on the ptr site! Truly the best sunscreen I‚Äôve used. I have oily skin and medium skin tone and this is great. There is no white casts, it is dewy but can easily be made matte with a little powder. It works wonderfully under makeup and other products and has never pilled on me. I tried all the other sunscreens in the sampler pack and this is by far the best one. The price is definitely steep, but I‚Äôm willing to pay that price for a product that I actually want to put on my face. This is not like a white, sticky, smelly sunblock that you dread putting on. You won‚Äôt even know it‚Äôs on and you can easily reapply in seconds and not have to put in elbow grease to avoid that white/grey look. If you‚Äôre on the fence and reading reviews to decide, just get it!

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: I am an obsessive daily sunscreen user and I got a travel size of this in the Sephora sunscreen sampler. This sunscreen is absolutely amazing for anyone with dry skin. I‚Äôve gravitated towards more liquid textured sunscreens in the past since thicker ones always felt difficult to rub in. But this one has a similar texture to a light moisturizer and rubs in and spreads easily. It does not sting at all. And it leaves a dewy finish, but not greasy. The sunscreen scent is very faint. Now I can‚Äôt wait until I use up my (fairly substantial) sunscreen stash so I can purchase this full size.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_title: The best moisturizer with a SPF
review_text: This has become my favorite all time moisturizer. It's very important to me for a moisturizer to have a SPF in it. Plus it's a bonus that it contains hyaluronic acid which is entirely new for me - I wanted to up my skincare routine. Before purchasing, I've read some reviews that people said it was more like a sunscreen... I would have to disagree with them. It does have a faint sunscreen smell when first applying it but there's no way I would compare it to the same thing as regular sunscreen. It absorbs nicely into my skin and leaves it smooth and moisturized. And to find a moisturizer that has a SPF of 45 is awesome. Typical moisturizer only has 25 or 30 SPF. I have fair skin and SPF is very important to me since I burn easily. I will be purchasing again and again.

unique_id: PETER THOMAS ROTH-Water Drench Hyaluronic Hydrating Moisturizer SPF 45
review_text: I was excited about this because I am trying to add more SPF to my routine and I loved the idea. But I have extremely sensitive eyes and even though I didn‚Äôt apply this near my eyes, I must have sweat into them because my eyes were tearing up all day and I tried it for several days.

review_text: I love the way this feels; not greasy or heavy like so many creams with SPF can be. I applied it in the morning and didn‚Äôt think about it the rest of the day. I did like how this feels both when I apply it and once it‚Äôs on my skin a bit better than Matte Screen, though. I do think it helped moisturize my skin a bit without making me oilier.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Might work for some but not for me
review_text:
As a sunscreen, this works. As a serum, it works. That's the only reason that this is getting two, rather than one, star. 
I really wanted to like this product -- the serum/sunscreen combo is one I'm usually a fan of. However, this stuff smells...yeasty. It smells like an english muffin that's been toasted and sprayed in banana boat. I get that it's fragrance free and that's great, but the scent that is present is offensive enough that it's turning off a lot of people who would otherwise be open to using it. It's also NOT for oily skin types. It's very wet and it takes forever to dry, and it's also very thin and liquidy so it can run everywhere. If you have dry/normal skin, don't mind strong and maybe unpleasant smells, and are looking for an effective sunscreen and serum, then this could be for you. But it isn't for me.

review_text: Product separates; doesn‚Äôt help to shake before use. By the end of the bottle I‚Äôm pretty sure all of the sunscreen had separated and been pumped out, and I was getting whatever the pure clear grease was. Cannot recommend.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I've been using this for around 3 weeks now and I see a good difference. I feel like this product has helped me with my acne and skin texture is so much better

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I originally bought this to combine my sunscreen and vitamin c step into 1 step. But this sunscreen made my skin greasy and shiny and not in a glowing dewy way. My skin is not naturally oily. The pump is not well designed either. Sometimes when I use it, the product squirts everywhere. The liquid comes out looking separated even from the beginning. I like the concept of this product but it‚Äôs too greasy for my skin.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Leaves my skin soft and glowy!
review_text: This goes on a little heavy, so I apply in the morning and then let it rest for about 15 minutes while I do my hair and get dressed, THEN apply moisturizer and makeup. After it's been on my skin for that little "waiting period', it feels really soft and healthy, and the coverage still feels good. I think this might be a little bit *too* heavy for acne-prone skin, but if that's not a concern, I think it feels very rich and healthy and protective. One star off because while the wait is worth it to me, it is certainly slightly inconvenient when I'm in a hurry.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I have combination skin and this sunscreen with vitamin C gives my skin a super beautiful glow. If you like a matt look, this is not for you. This glowy look highlights in all the right area and the fluid texture (1 pump and a little bit more) makes it easy to spread. You'll be be able to see which part you missed out on because of the lack of "glow". I don't get breakouts and wouldn't hesitate to stock up on this!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Supergoop! Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I just bought it with my another account. The liquid only fulfill half of the bottle. It‚Äôs still greasy even though  it‚Äôs already more refreshing than most of the supergoop product line.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Supergoop! Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I bought this on a whim and I've been using it after lotion on my body and I LOVE the results. I have pretty bad hyperpigmentation and KP on my arms and I feel like this has really helped with hydration and reducing the hyperpigmentation.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: The product itself is OK to good - I was trying to cut down the steps in my AM routine and a combo Vitamin C and SPF seemed great. The texture is a little odd - it doesn't look mixed correctly when it comes out, but I mix it in my hands to apply. It doesn't leave my skin tacky, sticky, or shiny which is a miracle for SPF! However, the worst part of this is the packaging. The tiny little pump means product spills either all over the bottle or sprays all over the counter and my clothes. Whatever way it's distributed inside, I was barely halfway through the bottle and had to tilt it to get product out our it would pump dry. Awful packaging. I tossed the other half.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: Very nice product! I wasn't expecting that I will be more than satisfied!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text:
I wanted to love this but unfortunately it didn‚Äôt work out for me.
I had to return it because I noticed my skin slowly reacting to it after 2 days and now my face is getting rashes around my mouth, eye and cheek area‚Ä¶
I‚Äôd say I‚Äôm cautious with what I put on my skin but I wanted to incorporate a type of oil but not anymore.

Also, vitamin C is an ingredient that‚Äôs very difficult to stabilize and I learned that it also isn‚Äôt effective when mixed with spf, so if you‚Äôre buying for the benefit of that, I might as well skip this.

If it works for you, great. But you honestly won‚Äôt know until you try it. It didn‚Äôt work out for me, so I‚Äôm giving it a 1 star..

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Supergoop! Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: Love the texture and finish. I have dry skin so this was a great first step in my skincare routine.

Prefer their other formula.

It has also helped even my skin tone. I‚Äôve had acne through my mid-twenties and this is definitely helping me recover from that.

review_text: After using it for a while I definitely do see improvement in my skin. The nozzle is a nightmare, I dislike how it comes out of the bottle. It does give you a very dewy look.. someone asked me if I was hot because It looked like I was sweating. LOL

review_text: I use it with their mineral spf powder and it works great. I have a combo skin and was worried about breaking out and looking greasy. unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: Don‚Äôt recommend at all. Feels like applying oil on my face. And it is so greasy. Absolutely a no no product.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum

review_text: Love it. Perfect to start a dewy look. Also love that it is 2 in 1.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: While I love the idea of a combo product for a quicker morning routine, I wasn‚Äôt a fan of this product. I found it very sticky. Also, I wasn‚Äôt sure if I was using enough to get any sun protection. Save your money.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I'm such a fan of supergoop's other sunscreens that I had to give this one a try and oof I was disappointed. I'm not sure if it's my skin type or if it's the product, but I look greasier than a butterball on Thanksgiving after applying. It never seemed to soak in either. I really wanted to love this since it has SPF + vitamin C, but I guess I can't have it all.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I ordered this because I loved the idea behind an spf and vitamin C in one! If you plan on to use this as your only spf for the day, I recommend using this as your last step in your skincare routine. My face is definitely brighter and more youthful after using this product! The only con is that you absolutely need to set your face with setting powder afterwards. I usually just conceal my under eyes and add Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood filter to my cheeks and forehead. I definitely have to make another step and set my face with setting powder to cut the oil/shine on my face. I‚Äôm ok with adding the extra step to my routine but it would be nice if I didn‚Äôt have to. Great product but 4 stars for being super oily.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Supergoop! Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: Love all so supergoop‚Äôs stuff, but stay away from this one if you have oily skin. I was left looking like a greasy chicken nugget after about an hour

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: Very oily, even i have dry skin it still pretty hard to go thru my skin. this sunscreen way too much oily absorb very slow made my skin feel uncomfortable and sticky. I wouldnt rec to anyone. Now i have to use i for body instead of face. :(

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I really wanted to like this but was so oily.  I thought it would be more like a serum.  I guess maybe good for someone who‚Äôs dry but this did not work for me.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: People are saying I am glowing
review_text: I acrually like this. People are saying my skin is glowing. Not oily, but glowing. It is a bi-phase solution so shaking it helps with consistent dispensing. But I will keep using.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text:
Here are the facts:
Packaging? Horrible. The pump gets stuck and its hard to get the product out, I have bought it 2 or 3 times but it happens every time.
Formula... people are right, it does not absorb quickly and it makes you glowy af. This can and will make your make up look oily if you put it on top. HOWEVER... I love it anyway. I use this every morning and night if I can, and it makes my skin look smooth, glowy, evens out my skin tone, it is also one of the FEW SPFs that don't break me out. I follow up with concealer and a mattifying pressed powder when I need to and it gives me a perfect natural finish.

I will buy this again, but beware of the cons!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Not What I Was Hoping For
review_text: The packaging on this product was so poorly thought out. Since it's a curved bottle with a short pump when you try to dispense product it doesn't all go onto your fingertips because you can't put you can only put one finger under the pump and this is a very liquidy formula. You have to pick it up and tilt it to dispense better. Considering how expensive this product is and how little product you get I'd hope that would have at least been better. As for the formula, it's greasy and takes what feels like hours to sink in but if you're reapplying as often as directed it won't ever fully absorb. I haven't tried this with makeup on and I have no desire to considering how greasy it is. It seems like makeup will not mesh well with it, but I'm not sure since I didn't try it. Overall, I was expecting so much more since I like their unseen sunscreen.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Supergoop! Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: Hydrating formula, but unless you have lots of sun damage or noticeably uneven pigmentation you won't really notice the efficacy of the Vitamin C. Really great concept but it doesn't absorb well into the skin and ends up in the eyes which will cause stinging. Wish I could love this product.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: Supergoop is a great company I have other products that are mind blowing (like unseen sunscreen) however there is something really wrong with this product. At the beginning it seems ok but at the end of the day my face looks more tired and off than usually. My face doesn‚Äôt like this product and I don‚Äôt recommend it. I wish I bought their unseen sunscreen instead of this.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum

review_text: I love this stuff.  You do have to shake a bit before using.  It‚Äôs like their oil sunscreen with Vit C and reflective particles..   it makes me look like I am glowing.  I will mix it with a bit of foundation if I feel I need some coverage.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text:
This isn‚Äôt for me. At all. Supergoop‚Äôs daily dose vitamin c sunscreen is much heavier than your average serum, though not as heavy as a thick cream or pure oil. 

I bought this in hope I could get some for my mother, who hates skincare and would love an all-in-one product. 

But it feels like pure oil on my skin. When I wear it, I skip moisturizer all together. Despite this, it feels so heavy and boreline sticky on my skin. I hate it so much. I‚Äôll be sticking with my og vitamins c serum and Supergoop‚Äôs Unseen Sunscreen. It‚Äôs the only way to go.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: Not worth the money, honestly I can get way more product from a SPF else where. It leaves residue and doesn‚Äôt lay well under makeup. It has a super strong smell that I cannot get used too.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I pretty much never write reviews, but this product was so bad I felt like I had leave one. I received a deluxe sample of this product. It was horrible. The product was so greasy and left my face a complete mess. I might as well have sprayed cooking spray directly on my face based on how greasy it was. I tried it on 3 different days with the same result each time. Even after giving it plenty of time to soak in (+20 mins by the 3rd attempt) it still basically made my makeup slide right off. I wasn‚Äôt even able to make it through a full day before I had to wash my face and start over because it was so bad. I‚Äôve never had quite this same experience. I don‚Äôt know what they put in this thing but it is ridiculous. If I could give it zero stars I would.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I love this product. It brightens your skin, hydrates and protects all in one. Best product ever.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum

review_text: Love this product! Have noticed a difference in my skin and like that I can skip a step in my routine since it is serum and SPF in one. Definitely give it time to settle into your skin before you apply makeup or another product or else you will feel greasy.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I actually love this serum‚Äôs texture and definitely wouldn‚Äôt describe it as ‚Äústicky‚Äù. I consistently used Vitamin C before trying this, so I‚Äôm not sure I saw huge results, but I love that it‚Äôs 2 steps in 1. I‚Äôm pretty sure I‚Äôd buy this again.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I rather like this spf and that I don‚Äôt need to apply an extra vitamin C serum. Other people complain that it‚Äôs a bit sticky‚Äîit is but I use hyaluronic acid serum after I wash my face so for me the sunscreen glides on pretty easily. I haven‚Äôt noticed any improvement of my skin tone but I have not had any breakouts or negative reactions so I‚Äôm happy. I like how supple my skin feels after applying this and I find that I‚Äôm hydrated all day. I would buy it again!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I wanted to love this so much and I‚Äôm giving 4 stars simply because of the convenience factor of a vitamin c serum paired with spf - one less step in a beauty routine! However, as other people have mentioned, the texture is not great. It‚Äôs sticky, and the stickiness definitely lingers even after a few minutes to allow for absorption. I typically remain barefaced after sunscreen and vitamin c but if I were the type to use foundation or concealer, I would not want to use it on top of this product - seems like a recipe for clogged pores and break-outs.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Supergoop! Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I‚Äôm a black woman and this sunscreen/serum is amazing. I substitute it for my moisturizer and it works wonderfully. You don‚Äôt need much. I see this product has a lot of mixed reviews, but honestly I feel like it could be because ppl aren‚Äôt using it properly. If you are oily, you should use this by itself and if you‚Äôre super dry, you can also add in a moisturizer. This is my honest opinion. It is not a paid review. Just wanna give you all a diff perspective on it.  :)

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: When I saw this product I was very excited as it combined my two am products. Unfortunately, when i put it on my face, it was super thick and cakey. My skin felt like it had paint on it, and all i wanted to do was wash it off. I don't wear a lot of makeup on my face, so i am probably extra sensitive to this, but it is way too thick for me to wear, and I will be sticking to individually adding Vitamin C serum and sunscreen.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I wanted to love this but it has an oily finish and makes my face super shiny and greasy feeling

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I received this product complimentary from Supergoop. I really love the consistency of this product. Feels very light on the skin. It really hydrates skin. I am very pleased with it. I highly recommend.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_title: Supergoop! Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: I am 41 with normal to dry skin that breaks out with nearly every sunscreen I try, and I absolutely love this one. No breakouts at all, it is beautiful to prime the skin before foundation. Leaves a youthful glow to my skin. I don‚Äôt use other moisturizers with it as I get plenty of moisture from just this. I use 2-3 pumps and it heavily coats my face. I have to work it in. I don‚Äôt notice a smell at all on my skin.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Daily Dose Vitamin C + SPF40 Serum
review_text: i don't know why this has such negative reviews!! i have been using this for a few months and really love it. i have super dry skin so i really don't mind that it has an oilier/more dewy consistency. i probably would not recommend for someone with oily skin. i also layer on top of some other serums, so i don't have a problem with tackiness. i used without additional spf during the winter, but when the uv index is higher i layer more sunscreen on top as the last step in my skincare routine. tl;dr this is great for dry skin if you want extra glow and hydration with built in sun protection!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: It is too heavy on the face. It feels as if you are applying oil on your face. And it‚Äôs pills on top of your skincare. Definitely would not recommend unless you have chronically dry skin!

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: Made me feel oily and shiny

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: This is absolutely terrible. It‚Äôs a super liquid form which I can‚Äôt stand and it makes you look as white as a ghost when you put this on. I returned this the next day. I have been using Bliss and will continue to use that instead. Sucks bc I wanted to love this.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: Supergoop! Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: Wow. Just wow. Amazing product overall. I tried it in the morning after my simple morning routine and went on my skin flawlessly, doesn‚Äôt require much blending at all, doesn‚Äôt pill, doesn‚Äôt look oily (and I have oily T zone and normal skin on my cheeks) looks glossy but not oily. Doesn‚Äôt look oily throughout the day either, when it‚Äôs time to reapply it goes on smoothly without any pilling and doesn‚Äôt look gross. I even decided to reapply with makeup on and it looks great!! I‚Äôm actually really surprised it looks perfectly fine over makeup (I don‚Äôt wear heavy makeup). I have light acne prone skin on my T zone for reference. 10/10 would recommend.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++

review_text: Never felt like it absorbed well on my skin and it made me look very oily. The sheerscreen was so much better and would not purchase this again. Also hated the packaging! Top would not stay on so would be terrible to travel with.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: This lotion does what it says - it protects the skin, has got clean ingredients and is safe for everyone/thing. The amazing bonus is that it will not leave a white cast! It is a sun safety product so it is not designed to be a primer for makeup or applied after makeup. I use this after I apply my Glow Recipe Pinapple C Bright Serum as it corrects dark spots but also requires sun protection. I do not wear a foundation with this lotion as it simply would not work (I'm still wearing a mask outside anyway...). I have combo skin and this lotion gives my skin a nice, even, glow - it will sink in after an hour so applying makeup after an hour could be done (not with oily skin I think). It is the best SPF lotion I have tested! I had zero issues with the pump/packaging as mentioned by various reviewers.

review_text: I bought this hoping it would work for my sensitive skin. While it didn't irritate me, it didn't seem to protect as well and I ended up getting burned or got super dark and splotchy in some places just from being out in the sun for an hour. I do tan easily but I also burn and I am very generous with my sunscreen applications from head to toe. I haven't used any acids for 4 months and haven't exfoliated in 2 weeks so my skin wasn't prone to being hyper sensitive to UV rays. This week I had 2 pumps of this spf 40 on my face, neck and chest and some spf 30 on my body and faced away from the sun most of the time and my face still got burned which turned into really dark areas and looks like I'm wearing foundation thats too dark for me. Not to mention this stuff doesn't smell to great. I'll use it up but will definitely follow up with another sunscreen and won't repurchase.

review_text:
I bought this from another retailer. Upon receiving it, the cap does not work: it is a bit too small, and I cannot put the cap on. so now I'm left with this product that can only be used at home. I cannot travel with it.

In terms of the texture, it is not the best. It just "sits" on my skin. When applying it, I don't feel like it is being absorbed or anything, and hours after applying it, I can rub it off easily with my fingers.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I have extremely sensitive and normal-to-dry skin that over produces oil if it is slightly irritated. I have used SPF from sooo many brands, including other Supergoop! products and have struggled deeply. Most broke me out, turned my face into an oil slick, and/or felt so heavy on my skin. Based on the reviews, I expected this to the same. But, it didn‚Äôt! This is a very light fluid that feels completely weightless, you cannot see it on the skin at all, and even though it feels a tiny bit oily when it goes on, it absorbs beautifully in about 15 minutes. So, I put it on, drink my morning tea, and then continue with makeup. Love this so much. The only thing I would change is to bump up the protection to SPF 50 PA++++. But seriously, that‚Äôs it. I love that it‚Äôs clean, I love that I can use it while breastfeeding. Five stars.

It also doesn't smell sunscreen-y (thank the lord). I have purchased this multiple times and it never fails.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: Not good for oily or medicated skin
review_text:
I'll say that this review is HIGHLY personal. If you have dry/combo skin, it might be great for you.

I have combo/oily skin, but am using tretonoin, so parts of my face are in the peeling stage. I put this on after moisturizer and my looked so shiny, and the liquid formula make it hard to spread without getting the peely skin all over my face (yuck). 

I really have been liking the sheer Unseen Sunscreen - it goes on smoothly with no residue - but I wanted to try a mineral sunscreen because I've read that chemical sunscreens can contain harmful ingredients. The FDA has not determined the full effects of chemical sunscreen ingredients and are still testing, so I am going back to the Unseen until I heard differently.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: This sunscreen is amazing. I have very sensitive combination skin which leans on the dry side with an oily t-zone. I also have rosacea and perioral dermatitis. I am just now beginning to add skincare back into my routine due to a long exhausting road to treating my perioral dermatitis. This sunscreen does not irritate my sensitive skin at all and in fact seems to be helping it! It is not greasy at all. Zero white cast. It blends right into my skin after about 5 minutes to a completely natural finish. Not matte, not oily/greasy/shiny. It‚Äôs literally perfect. I will say it‚Äôs not very moisturizing. I‚Äôve been wearing it alone but did wear it with my moisturizer one day and had no issues but felt a bit more moisturized overall. Otherwise my face gets dry with this alone. Also the tint to this blends right in to match my tone yet also almost blurs imperfections for a more even tone. Truly an amazing sunscreen. I hope they never discontinue!

review_text: Meh. As I‚Äôm writing this review, this product is out of stock. I don‚Äôt quite understand why. I had high hopes for this sunscreen. It might just be my combination of products but this pills a lot unless I fully let my moisturizer settle into my skin. It‚Äôs also quite greasy, I find, which isn‚Äôt great for someone with combination skin to start with. The only reason o haven‚Äôt returned this product is because I think it could come in handy for reapplying sunscreen throughout the day (if I have to go outside). I use another mineral sunscreen in the morning that leaves a bit of a white cast. I spend a considerable amount of time rubbing and blending that in before putting on my makeup. I don‚Äôt mind this but I obviously can‚Äôt reapply that same sunscreen on top of my makeup. So my plan is to carry Zincscreen with me if I have to be out in the sun, so I can reapply it.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text:
Holy grail product since i retired my last holy grail daily sunscreen (Clinique Pep Start - still a great product, but owned by the Lauder fam, so no more for me.)

Not as finely textured as Pep Start, but otherwise feels very similar, goes on much the same, leaves a similarly dewy, moist, glowy finish. If you prefer a matte finish or a finish that truly dries as it sets, this likely isn‚Äôt going to be your fave product‚Äî but, if you‚Äôre 45 like me and are finding that the natural glow of your teens & 20s is harder and harder to come by, you‚Äôll love this.

Basically functions as a tinted moisturizer but with a secret superpower of fully functional mineral sun protection‚Äî it‚Äôs most of my daily face needs in one bottle. I haven‚Äôt used it with makeup (haven‚Äôt needed to), so i don‚Äôt know if it pills when functioning as a layer. I‚Äôd be worried that it wouldn‚Äôt stay put under other things, compromising the spf‚Ä¶ but again, i haven‚Äôt tested it in a layered situation, it just feels like that might be an issue.

Photo: The Ordinary ascorbyl glucoside solution  12%, supergoop zinc screen, stila convertible color blush in peony. Zinc screen is doing the heavy lifting.

review_text: I love this sunscreen. My favorite thing about it is that you don‚Äôt have to tug on your skins to spread it around your face. It takes some getting used to but it‚Äôs my go to daily sunscreen and I‚Äôve had no problem with pilling as others have mentioned.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: Perfect for my mid-thirties combination skin
review_text: This is my HG sunscreen. I am lighter complexion with a yellow undertone (I am mostly Irish, Italian and black) and this blends in nicely with a rosy sheen that is not sparkly. It soaks in after application in two minutes or so. In summer it may be a tad too light for my skin tone, but I‚Äôll cross that bridge when I get there. It moisturizers my VERY difficult to moisturize skin (nearly everything breaks me out except aloe) and compliments my retinol well in controlling any breakouts. I use a tad on my eyelids and it also seems to stay put. I am going to buy several bottles in case they discontinue!

review_text: I really wanted to love this. It felt great on my skin when I tested it out, but it does not layer well with other skincare. It pills like crazy.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: It has a nice glow but it is greasy. Even though my skin is dry, I don't think I can use this in Spring and Summer. However, during Winter, it gives a nice moisturize glow.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: Supergoop! Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I love this sunscreen! It‚Äôs in my top 3 favorite sunscreens (and I‚Äôve tried a bunch!) This is my one and only favorite tinted mineral sunscreen because it works well with my neutral skin tone (I find that a lot of tinted sunscreens nowadays have a warm tone that just doesn‚Äôt work for neutral and cool skin tones.) It adds a nice glow without being greasy and it prevents my skin from getting oily throughout the day. It feels hydrating and it‚Äôs fragrance free! Won‚Äôt sting your eyes, either.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text:
I love how this looks on a no makeup day! It just very slightly evens things out and gives you a glow (I have oily skin and its not too much). I dont know how it looks on darker skin tones but the tint is very light and its a runny lotion consistency, not a cream so I think it would work for most. 

Love having a mineral spf option that I actually like using. This also works really well with the Kosas tinted face oil and doesnt make it break up. I will say if you have dry patches or peel sometimes from retinol (like me) this does sort of cling to it and more so if you reapply it but its not  bad at all. Overall really love this one

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: Supergoop! Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: The first time I used it I was very turned off because a clear oily liquid came out with some specks of pigment. I also thought the texture was very oily the first time I used it. Over time after shaking before using, making sure to press into my skin, and let it sink in for about 5 minutes before applying makeup I really enjoy it. I use about 3.5-4 pumps for my face and neck and it‚Äôs only 1.7 ounces so I don‚Äôt know how long it will last. I do love that it‚Äôs pa+++ I generally really enjoy it. Definitely would more recommend for normal/dry skin.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I feel like the review on this product don't do it justice. It's a great mineral sunscreen. It has a light tint that matched my fair skin and lightly covers my redness/ smooths my complexion. It does take maybe 5 minutes to fully dry down and I think the best way to apply is by patting into the skin. It does work well under makeup, just want until the sunscreen is DRY to apply and it will look great and does not pill. Overall its a great sunscreen that does well for my combination, sensitive skin.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: This sunscreen does not play well with moisturizer. It applies smoothly without pilling but it leaves this beige residue on my fingers! I end up having to wash my hands with soap every time I apply sunscreen. To be fair, I did try applying it to my skin without moisturizer and it absorbed fine. However, I have dry skin and this SPF by itself is simply not moisturizing enough.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_title: ‚ÄúRadiant‚Äù finish for normal to dry skin
review_text:
If you like a ‚Äúglow‚Äù or ‚Äúsheen‚Äù and have normal to dry skin and a pale to medium skin tone, then this sunscreen is perfect for you. Unfortunately for me, I was not into the ‚Äúglow‚Äù or ‚Äúsheen‚Äù this gave my oily skin. Too bad, since this brand only offers 2 products without chemical sunscreens, which irritate my sensitive skin with mild rosacea. (But both of those - the MATTE SCREEN and the CC/BB CREAM - are good. The CC/BB CREAM is just a little glowy, while the MATTE is... well... relatively matte, for several hours, until my oils finally break through.) 

This did not leave a serious white cast behind... but then I have fair skin, so that may be why it wasn‚Äôt an issue for me. And any ‚Äúpaleness‚Äù was easily covered with a lightly tinted setting powder or a light dusting of powder foundation. 

For me, this is a no due to the finish, but for those that like a ‚Äúradiant‚Äù look, this might be a product to try.

unique_id: SUPERGOOP!-Zincscreen 100% Mineral Lotion SPF 40 PA+++
review_text: I really love this as a daily sunscreen. I find it easy to apply, it leaves a pretty slightly dewy finish on my skin with no white cast and it works well under makeup. I haven't notice any greasiness or pilling like other users - I usually use my fingers and pat it in to apply 1-2 pumps. It is expensive for me, but I haven't found something cheaper that I like as much. I do think it's more of a basic daily sunscreen and you might need reapplication or a stronger sunscreen for an all-day outdoor adventure (I've ended up with a red nose after a day at the beach just applying this once).

unique_id: ALPHA-H-Daily Essential Moisturiser SPF 50+ with Vitamin E
review_text:
I needed a sunblock to complement some glycolic peel lotion I was using, and Alpha-H looked like a good brand to try based on reviews. 

I generally avoid sunblock as they make my face very shiny and greasy. unfortunately, this sunblock had the same effect. it's not as heavy as other brands of sunblock, but consequently, I've had some cystic breakouts on the forehead and they're taking a much longer time to clear. I can't help but link my newly greasy face to the breakout. 

I know sunblock counters ageing from exposure to UV, but seriously, why must the trade-off be a face that now looks like it can reflect sun rays back at other people?

unique_id: ALPHA-H-Daily Essential Moisturiser SPF 50+ with Vitamin E
review_text: This goes out to sunscreen nerds out there! 1. The sunscreen in this product is primarily Homosalate. 2. The listing claims that this product is broad spectrum however there is no indication of this on the actual product or its box - nothing that says broad spectrum, UVA/UVB, and no PA factor either. 3. I‚Äôve been using it for over a month now and 7/10 times it does ball up on my skin. 4. It has quite a strong sunscreen smell and I found it lingered. 5. While it was moisturizing, it was not hydrating so I had to put on a hydrating cream underneath. 6. I like the dispenser as it is sanitary and easy to control however the cap has nearly chipped away to nothing and I‚Äôm fairly dainty with my hands. The verdict? I‚Äôll finish it up but will definitely not be repurchasing.

unique_id: LANC√îME-UV Expert Youth-Shield‚Ñ¢ Tone Up Milk SPF50 PA++++
review_title: Hello shimmering youthful skin! Goodbye sunspots!
review_text:
I love this product! I‚Äôm on my 4th tube.  Keeps my sunspots at bay. I‚Äôm in my 40s, with dry skin.  This product protects my skin from the sun, whilst also leaving a shimmering healthy glow.  I rarely leave a review, but I have to rave about this product, because it is great!

My previous fave sunscreen was by SK2 SPF50 Whitening sun screen, but this was discontinued several years ago.  Since then, I‚Äôve tried multiple brands (Eucerin, Dior, Chanel, BioEssence), but none gave me a bright healthy glow and prevented/reduced sunspots.  Thank goodness I finally found a worthy replacement - this product.  

My search is over, this is my holy grail for facial sunscreen.  I only need to use a tiny bit of CC Cream to provide light coverage on a few stubborn blemishes, otherwise this sunscreen does a great job for the rest of my face.

I agree with the other reviewer that this suncreen leaves an oily sheen. If you prefer a less shimmering finish, a light dusting with a large powder brush of loose face powder (I use Terry - Hyalauronic Hydra Powder) leaves a flawless finish and removes the oily sheen.

unique_id: LANC√îME-UV Expert Youth-Shield‚Ñ¢ Tone Up Milk SPF50 PA++++
review_text: Beautiful packaging that‚Äôs befitting of Lanc√¥me. However quite disappointing this is the exact kind of expensive sunblock you wish it didn‚Äôt have all the bad results - doesn‚Äôt sit well under makeup, make you look like an oil slick shortly after and throughout the day. The pearly white tone up milk did as it claims - gives your face pearly glow (micro shimmers) and does leaves a white cast as it‚Äôs supposed to brighten the tone of your skin and give the false impression of radiance.

review_text: TF sunscreen is the closest to makeup quality I‚Äôve found yet , aside from Sisley. I have several clients who hate the feel of sunscreen under their makeup yet never even notice when I Use This TF screen. Excellent protection with a veil like feel.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: I cannot rave enough about this moisturizer from Tom Ford. It the holy grail for me, after years of searching for the right combination of excellent moisturizing, high SPF, and something that won‚Äôt clog my pores. I used to have oily to combination skin but as I‚Äôve aged through my 40‚Äôs I now have dry skin and despite exhaustive efforts to the contrary I still breakout occasionally. This TF moisturizer checks all my boxes plus it feels so amazing as it goes on and leaves my skin feeling softer than ever. Yes, the cost is high, but after searching as long as I did, the price is a drop in the bucket compared with all I‚Äôve spent on products that didn‚Äôt work. Trust me, when you find ‚Äòthe one‚Äô you know it and it is worth the extra $$.

review_text:
For the price, nothing special
