review_title: Tom Ford Beauty Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: It is Tom ford and the quality is present. It is perfect for my dry sensitive skin. It leaves you as if you have applied a highlighter-just dewy and glowing. I wear it on weekends with no other makeup. The bottle is very small but the quality compensates for the quantity.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: Just repurchased. It is an all time fav. for me. Honestly, I wanted a great sunscreen that protected, but didn't look bad under makeup. This did just the trick!

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_title: Really works for dry, sensitive skin
review_text: I have very dry, very sensitive skin. When look for a primer, I need one that won't dry out my skin (or--even better--adds moisture). When looking for a sunscreen, I need one that won't irritate my skin enormously or dry it out. This is the only chemical sunscreen that doesn't irritate my skin. AMAZING! And it's not brutally drying the way mineral sunscreens typically are. (The exception is the LaRoche Posay one, but that's weirdly oily and unpleasant.) For me, this product is worth the painful price. It solves the sunscreen problem while providing a gorgeous base for a tinted moisturizer or foundation. Perfection.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: I bought this because I was obsessed with Tom Ford makeup for a bit. It's a high SPF sunscreen that's also a very effective primer that improves the application and longevity of foundation. I have not tried this with a lighter foundation/tinted moisturizer to know how that combination works out. However, I don't think it is worth the high price point. One very well can buy a good sunscreen and a separate primer for the money.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: I won't recommend this as a sunscreen, but it can be a good "all-in-one makeup base" for DRY skin. That's what it is for, I guess. It was very oily on my face and too light for a sunscreen.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_title: Tom Ford Beauty Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: I love this product!  To me, it is worth every penny.  I look in the mirror and I am so happy because my face looks so smooth and my makeup lasts.  The SPF is also very important to me.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_title: Nice but There are Cheaper that Work Better
review_text: Nice primer that does help my foundation go on smoother and last longer. I do have a few others that perform the same or better and are less than 1/2 the price of this one. Also, this does not control oil well.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: I have never written a product review but I want to let people know what a great product this is. I usually hate most facial sunscreens because of the smell, consistency, and tendency toward greasiness. While this doesn't smell that great, it goes on very well and actually improves the texture/appearance of my skin. In fact, I keep looking in my compact mirror because the improvement is quite noticeable. Even though it is crazy expensive I definitely recommend this product!

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_title: Tom Ford Beauty Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: This is a pretty moisturizing sunscreen that works really well under makeup. As a primer, I would say that it makes makeup look better but doesn't help it last longer. I also wouldn't recommend it for oily skin, as it made me touch oily throughout the day and I have dry skin.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: I have sensitive, combination skin. I usually wear Tatcha sunscreen under my foundation with a few drops of Tatcha's gold camellia beauty oil. I love that combination because it gives me a lit from within look while minimizing pores and keeping my T-zone matte and doubles as a makeup primer. Sadly, both Tatcha and Sephora are currently sold out of the Tatcha sunscreen and since I love all of the Tom Ford Beauty products that I own, I decided to give this a go. It doesn't break me out, a little goes a very long way (so even though the bottle isn't that big, it will last you a long time), it provides a smooth canvas for makeup application, doesn't settle into pores or fine lines, no white cast, and doesn't have any offensive fragrance. This sunscreen is moisturizing and is a great base for makeup application. I love using it under the TF traceless Foundation stick. It gives a slightly dewy finish, so I do powder my t-zone after makeup application and it lasts all day. I occasionally spray my cheeks with 1-2 sprays of the Tatcha luminous dewy skin mist to give my cheeks a little extra lumination. If you have normal to dry skin, you could totally spritz it on your whole face, but an expert from Tatcha was gracious enough to teach me how to apply their luminous dewy skin mist for an afternoon pick me up, for those of us with combination to oily skin. If you had an extremely long day of makeup wear ahead, I would recommend applying a primer over this sunscreen. But for me, my makeup lasts longer than usual (without a touch up), using this sunscreen as a base for my makeup. This sunscreen works well for those with sensitive skin, normal, and combination skin. Those with oily skin could pull this off with a mattifying primer applied over the areas get extra oily throughout the day. And while this sunscreen is moisturizing, those with really dry skin will want to make sure to properly moisturize dry patches prior to applying this sunscreen. I am personally 100% satisfied with this sunscreen as an alternative to my HG Tatcha sunscreen. I will keep this sunscreen on hand from now on because it is challenging for me to find a sunscreen that lives up to my skin's needs. If you are on the fence about this sunscreen, get a sample of it from your local Sephora or Tom  Ford Beauty counter, you won't be disappointed and all skin types can find a way to make this sunscreen work well with or without makeup. I can say that for very few of the dozens that I have tried.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: I am a very fair skinned redhead and I live in the desert. Sunscreen is just not optional for me, it's a must. I constantly search out and try new products in the hope of finding "the one".  This is it.  I've been using Tatcha for quite a while which I thought was as close to perfect as sunscreen could get. It doesn't hold a candle to this. This applies and melts into the skin like skincare.  How they did this, I don't know.  Don't care either, as long as TF keeps making it.  It also works very well as a primer. No pilling, no sliding, just lays down a really smooth base.  Yes, it is awfully expensive for 1 oz. I'm ordering multiples, that's how good it is.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text:
Not sure what is in this stuff but this... this is freaking AMAZING. For some reason I thought this was mostly SPF with a side-function of some primer capabilities. But no joke this is an amazing PRIMER. Easily blows all my other primers out of the water - I cant think off the top of my head something that is comparable. I just put it on today and my makeup looks... flawless. And I didnt even use a BeautyBlender today!! I want to keep looking in the mirror because I cant believe what I see. I would never describe my makeup as being flawless in general because of certain areas where I have noticeable texture on my skin. It can make application of certain products more difficult than it needs to be, but with this my skin looks SO SMOOTH, and my makeup application looks like I got it done by a pro - that flawless, polished feel of skin-loving makeup. I feel like this would be a great base for wedding makeup. It works hard and feels like nothing on the skin. It doesnt have a silicone feel like most primers, it actually feels more like a lightweight moisturizer and absorbs quickly. No greasy afterfeel on fingers either. Easiest application primer - no need to concentrate on certain areas, or deal with pilling particles. One and done - which is extra points in my book.

The obvious cons of this is the price, and you will find the size of the tube is really small(enough to fit in your hand), but yowza, I cant say that I have a desire to go back to $20-$30 primer after this. Mind blown. Cant believe Im saying this, but hopefully this is not limited edition.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: this is the best primer yet. a little pricey...but worth every penny. It goes on beautifully and gives my face a glow. Protects my skin is a plus! love this.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: My foundation sticks well to this and looks glowy, beachy and pretty. It looks like I eat healthy and exercise which I have been neglecting. It really looks like I spent time at a health spa or took a trip to "healing waters!" I love the look I get with my RCMA foundation and NARS creamy concealer!!! Thanks Tom for my present HG primer! And spf!

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_title: It is too oily for me
review_text: I live in Texas so you already know that humidity is a problem. I bought this product because of the couple of reviews I read that made the product sound amazing. However, it did not work for me. I am currently using Sunday Riley for my problem with acne. When I put this on my skin feels good but it looks like I am sweating. I have tried to wait at least half an hour between applying my Sunday Riley product and this. I have also waited half hour before putting my makeup on so that this product settles. Either way, my skin looks oily. I don't have oily skin and my acne was caused because of stress so I know it is not my skin that is the problem. I wanted to love this but it fell flat.

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: Love to use this as a primer and sunscreen. It does not have an oily consistency nor does it leave a white residue. It's not your typical sunscreen!

unique_id: TOM FORD BEAUTY-Face Protect Primer SPF 50/ PA ++++
review_text: Okay I know this is very expensive. But I have tried everything from Shiseido to Tatcha to Chanel, and I've officially found my holy grail sunscreen. It leaves a beautiful glow to your skin, without any grease or shimmer. Meanwhile, it also sits perfectly under makeup. In fact, my makeup looked a lot better. I received so many compliments on my skin since I've started using this. And no, this isn't just like any glowy primer. I've used everything from becca to Laura mercier to Armani for glowy primers. This just smoothes and blurs the skin while providing high protection. I sincerely hope this isn't limited.

First opened the bottle and noticed a sandy clumpy texture to the product - already weirded out by this. Not sure if it's because of the humidity, but upon application it leaves white clumps, and a visible white cast on my pale skin. (I'm only using one peasized drop which is not even a sufficient amount.) Worst of all - IT STINGS MY SKIN! After 10 mins of application, I can feel a weird tacky plastic feeling film on my face. When I perspire, it forms a milky white residue. Really disappointed with this.

Would give it a 0 star if I could.

I barely wear makeup and if I do go out it works just like a primer on my face. I love this umbrq drunk elephant sunscreen. Worth the purchase.

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text: I'm trying a sample and so far I like this. I was specifically looking for an everyday mineral based sunscreen without silicone for my sensitive, acne-prone skin and this was recommended to me. Yes the texture feels thick and suncreen-y when applying, but it sinks in fast and I totally forget about it after a minute. My skin felt nice all day, didn't get oily, and my makeup looked good - awesome! Worth the initial distaste over the texture for me. I didn't notice any white cast or pilling.

review_text: For this brand to produce such a huge quantity of sunscreen with a reasonable price is definitely a sweet calling to my expectation. unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_title: White Cast and Difficult to Blend
review_text: Very thick texture make it super difficult to blend on skin. Even after 15 minutes apply on skin, white cast is still obvious and it become worst if you are sweating. Did not mix well with primer/foundation, and makes my makeup cakey and uneven. I felt my skin is suffocating after applying this sunscreen and dry.

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text:
This doesnt leave me any white cast at all once it sets in . I squeeze it to my palm, warm it up and slowly rub the cream across my face in one direction. Not to overdo it . The white cast is quickly disappear, but it felt very heavy and oily on my skin for few minutes and longer if the weather is hot and humid. I also got very sweaty on my face once the cream is on my face. But once the cream sets in, i dont feel anything anymore except my oily skin got matte for the entire day. Yes entire day. I also wear it under bb cream. I got no more oily face . And actually feel fresh. 

It‚Äôs a weird experience with this cream but i like the overall results though the beginning of the day can be a little hard.

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text: I love this sunscreen. It gives me a dewy look and is moisturizing. It does leave a little bit of a white cast but I am not complaining since it gives a ‚Äúpowder‚Äù effect on my skin therefore, I do not need to use foundation or make-up. It also wears great under make-up.

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text:

review_text: Leaves a white sheen on your face when you use it. It does not absorb into your skin as much as it sits on top of it, making your skin oily.

review_text:

Overall i am pretty happy with it

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text: Im still unsure how i feel about this. I love how it makes my skin looks. I dont wear any make up/foundation/powder and this gives me a blurring effect and my skin looks flawless & glowy. The only reason im unsure if i‚Äôll repurchase it is i find that it‚Äôs not sweat proof? I naturally sweat around my ‚Äúmustache‚Äù area and given that we must wear a mask outside, i always find the creaks of my nose & under my nostrils, the sides of my mouth & at times my chin- dry and it flakes. I have not had this issue with another brand of sunblock. Granted the rest of my face is nice & GLOWLY. I‚Äôll for sure use it till it finishes & hopefully by then, work out a cocktail that works for me so that i can repurchase.

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text: to my fellow melanin rich sisters out there. this product is sadly not for us. it‚Äôs so so hard to find a good mineral sunscreen with no white cast but sadly this product has about the WORST white cast i have ever seen. HOWEVER it does have a huge redeeming factor. if you‚Äôre using this under makeup, then there‚Äôs no issue at all. it‚Äôs an amazing base for makeup and it‚Äôll give you a luminous glowy beat. if you plan on wearing this on its own without makeup, i strongly do not recommend.

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text: This has a prominent white cast that shows very well in your hairline and smile line. But I don't complain because the active ingredient here is zinc oxide and it is meant to be so. But if you have oily or sweaty face this is not for us. But I can work it under makeup. In a nutshell it is not so good for me as I sweat profusely

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text: I love this sunscreen because it‚Äôs not irritate my skin and it also can act as moisturiser since it‚Äôs quite hydrating and moisturising. For those that experienced peeling, don‚Äôt use any silicone based products. It won‚Äôt peel after you stopped using any silicone based products. That‚Äôs just my 2 cents tips

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text: I don't know how to start this comment but if I can put in one word, I would write it as HORRIBLE. I had high hope for this product. Starting from the day I ordered it at Sephora, I just couldn't wait for it to arrive. I was very excited. Once arrived I tried it the very next day in the morning before going to work thought it would be nice and smooth and invisible unlike other mineral sunscreens. I was so wrong. It leaves noticeable white cast on my face even on my fair skin. Worse still, it starts to form tiny white clumps when I try to evenly distribute it on my skin. Why? Why the tiny white clumps?? Even when you think you managed to evenly distribute the product on your skin, up close you'll see the product somehow accumulates in each and every single pore. How do you formulate your product? Didn't you conduct testing for acceptability on your finished product before selling? Yes, I'm pointing at you Drunk Elephant formula developers. Please. Your brand's philosophy is great. I respect that. But please, make sure it's coherent with the product that you create. My search for the best sunscreen continues.

unique_id: DRUNK ELEPHANT-Umbra‚Ñ¢ Sheer Physical Daily Defense Broad Spectrum Sunscreen SPF 30
review_text: So if I compare this to supergoop, I feel the sunscreen is abit more thicker. It does leave a white cast if u apply too much and u got to keep rubbing it on ur face to make it disappear. It‚Äôs worth the price but I do not think I will purchase again.

review_text: It‚Äôs actually quite satisfactory and it‚Äôs easy to blend. Most importantly, it doesn‚Äôt break me out. However, it does leave a slight white cast on my face and I will need to keep blending it. I will finish this tube but I won‚Äôt consider to repurchase.
